background.name: Palaeontologist

_.special: plaster of Paris with medical bandages
fist-sized fossil (bone fragment, claw, skull, ammonite, or trilobite)

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: a {@item shovel|PHB}, a {@item miner's pick|PHB}, a brush, plaster of Paris with medical bandages, a fist-sized fossil (bone fragment, claw, skull, ammonite, or trilobite), a traveller's {@item backpack|PHB}, a {@item tankard|PHB}, and 20 gp. in coins.

entries: Palaeontologists are those who have dedicated a portion of their lives to the study of ancient organisms and  environments. They are able to interpret how creatures may behave, based on their morphology.
{@variantrule Skill|PHB} proficiencies: {@skill Animal Handling} and {@skill Nature}.
Tool proficiencies: {@item Mason's tools|PHB}, {@item Cartographer's tools|PHB}, and  Research Scrolls.

entries.name: Suggested Feats and Ability Scores
entries: If you use your background to determine your ability score increases and provide a starting feat, we recommend the following:

entries.name: Feat:
entries: Naturalist (page 292) or Miner (page 292).

entries.name: Ability Scores:
entries: +1 Wisdom, +1 Intelligence, +1 Constitution.

entries.name: Research Scrolls:
entries: UNCOMMON, 50 gp., 2 lb. A collection of research scrolls on your chosen topic. When using these scrolls, select one skill from {@skill History}, {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}. If you spend 10 minutes studying the  scrolls, you gain temporary proficiency in the selected skill (or expertise if you are already proficient) for the next 6 hours. If you already have expertise in that skill, these do not provide any benefit.

entries.name: Paleontological Specialism
entries: In addition to being a general palaeontologist, you also specialise in one particular area of palaeontology. Roll a  {@dice d6} and consult the table below or choose whichever you find most appealing

rows: Theropoda. You can instantly recognise if a beast is carnivorous and likely to be hostile to you if you approach it further.
Cladistics. You can tell if a beast has been unnaturally altered or is not behaving of its own accord.
Ornithischia. Years of studying herbivores has given you insight into their behaviour. You can tell if they're likely to be hostile when approached.
Palaeobotany. You are able to recognise if a plant or plant-based creature may be dangerous.
Arthropoda. You can tell if large arthropods (i.e. giant spiders, giant scorpions, giant crabs etc.) inhabit an area.
Taphonomy. When encountering a carcass, you can easily tell how long the creature has been dead for

entries.name: Feature: Natural Historian
entries: You have advantage on {@skill History} checks that involve animals or the natural world.

entries.name: Feature: Hazard Training
entries: You are acutely aware of geological hazards and have proficiency on saving throws against geological hazards (i.e. falling from cliffs, escaping landslides, cave-ins, etc.).

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Palaeontologists come in many varieties. Below are some suggestions for traits, ideals, bonds, and flaws that a palaeontologist may have.

rows: I talk about fossils all the time, much to the annoyance of my friends.
I like to watch modern animal behaviour to learn how ancient animals behaved.
I'm always looking at the ground in front of me, just in case I spot a fossil.
I sometimes find myself staring into the distance, imagining what this area may have looked like millions of years ago.
Whenever we visit a city, the museum is the first place I want to go.
I love to doodle sketches of dinosaurs.
I keep fossils as jewellery and wear them all the time.
Whenever I meet a new creature, I'm always trying to figure out its place in the tree of life.
I see myself as a ‘Gentleman Scientist’. Studying these ancient creatures is a pastime that should be reserved for the academic elite.
Anyone with a trowel and the right attitude can do it! Let’s get in the dirt
There are wonders in our past that few people know about – I want to show them to everyone!
I’m a big fossil fan. Big teeth and big claws are what matter to me.
I want to be the name behind an awesome dinosaur
I’m a fossil dealer. These fossils have great value, and I can make my living selling them, even if it has to be done shadily
Theropoda. Sharp-toothed predatory dinosaurs excite you the most.
Sauropoda. Giant long-necked dinosaurs excite you the most.
Thyreophora. Heavily armoured dinosaurs excite you the most.
Marginocephalian. Crested and horned dinosaurs excite you the most.
Pterosauria. Flying reptiles excite you the most.
Sauropterygia. Marine reptiles excite you the most.
I’m a Splitter. Whenever I meet a non￾humanoid creature, I always assume it’s a new species and am wary of new abilities and behaviours it might have.
I’m a Lumper. I often assume that groups of similar beasts will all behave in the same way
I’m overly experimental, setting up little vials of acid with rocks sizzling in them wherever I rest.
I have a clumsy swing. I’m prone to hurting myself when trying to smash rocks.
I’m a bit vacant. My head is so stuck in the past that I often lose interest in conversation and daydream about ancient worlds.
I’m jaded. I’ve seen so many bones and carcasses that the sight of a dead body doesn’t bother me in the slightest.

background.name: Geologist

_.displayName: reinforced backpack that increases your carry weight by 20 lb

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: a {@item shovel|PHB}, a {@item miner's pick|PHB}, a {@item hammer|PHB} and  chisel, a reinforced {@item backpack|PHB} that increases your carry weight by 20 lb., gemstones worth 25 gp., and an  additional 10 gp. in coins.

entries: Geologists are those who have dedicated a portion of their  lives to the study of rocks and earthly processes. They are able to see beyond the immediately obvious and interpret the  landscape around them, providing valuable field knowledge.
{@variantrule Skill|PHB} proficiencies: {@skill History} and {@skill Nature}.
Tool proficiencies: {@item Mason's tools|PHB}, {@item Cartographer's tools|PHB}, Excavator's tools, and Analysis Tools.

entries.name: Suggested Feats and Ability Scores
entries: If you use your background to determine your ability score increases and provide a starting feat, we recommend the following:

entries.name: Feat:
entries: Tough or Miner (page 292).

entries.name: Ability Scores:
entries: +2 Constitution or Strength, +1 Intelligence.

entries.name: Excavator's Tools:
entries: COMMON, 5 gp., 8 lb. These tools are used to carefully extract fossils or minerals from rock/mud/ dirt. They cause your harvested gemstones to be 10% more valuable and harvested fossils to be 100% more valuable.

entries.name: Analysis Tools:
entries: COMMON, 10 gp., 1 lb. These tools provide a +2 to any skill check where you are examining an  object small enough to fit into your hand, regardless of the  skill you are using.

entries.name: Rock Specialism
entries: Your previous work as a geologist has given you a type of  rock that you're particularly passionate about. Roll a {@dice d8} and consult the table below or choose whichever you find most appealing.

rows: Fluvial. You love the sediments of rivers and streams and relish the opportunity to spend time wading in them. You're aware of the dangers of flooding.
Volcanic. The dramatic power of volcanoes excites you. You love to explore volcanic settings, but are wary of their dangers.
Calcareous. You love delving into natural caves, particularly those hollowed out by groundwater, but are very observant of potential cave-ins.
Shale. Deepwater sediments are your speciality. You jump at the opportunity to deep-dive into water, particularly in the ocean, and are a great swimmer.
Plutonic. You greatly enjoy walking on rolling hills, moors, and tors, and will favour taking longer routes if they take you over this terrain.
Metamorphic. You are particularly excited by sharp jagged metamorphosed rocks and can navigate them with ease.
Seams. You have a fixation on rare minerals and gemstones that can be found within rich rock seams. You will go out of your way to acquire rare gemstones.
Orogenous. You love mountains and mountain-climbing, and are very good at it. You always want to climb to the very top, if you can.

entries.name: Feature: Eye for Faults
entries: Years of studying geology allows you to easily select weak points in rock, allowing you to break it and tunnel with ease. You have a tunnelling speed of 5 ft.

entries.name: Feature: Rock Knowledge
entries: You can identify any rocks or gemstones at a glance, and know their value.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Palaeontologists come in many varieties. Below are some suggestions for traits, ideals, bonds, and flaws that a palaeontologist may have.

rows: Exploration is everything, I have to get out there and find new things.
I fancy myself as an adventurer, but I'm not as surefooted as I think I am.
I'm more of a bookworm, reading about other people's work and adventures.
Given the option between taking a tunnel and climbing a mountain, I'll always take the tunnel!
If it's in the ground, it's anyone's fair game!
I find anything geology related interesting and pick up little rocks everywhere I go.
I don't like clean-nosed, stuck-up scientists of other fields.
We dig rocks, then we drink lots!
I’m an academic at heart, I want to know everything there is about the deep past.
I’m a naturalist at heart. Look at the beauty of our world – isn’t it remarkable?!
I love spelunking. There’re treasures beyond measure down in the depths.
I only work as a contractor. I’ve got to get the job done, everything else is secondary.
I’m on the run as a lawbreaker. They’ll never find me if I’m deep underground.
I’m going to find the riches of a lifetime – there’s gold in them-there mountains, I can feel it.
My parent was a famous geologist – I’m following in their footsteps.
Our world is sacred, both in the present and past.
My mentor expects big things from me, I don’t want to disappoint.
I want to see firsthand the most impressive geological events - eruptions, earthquakes, and landslides!
If I can find the biggest, most precious gem, perhaps I can finally impress the person of my dreams.
The ancient past has mesmerised me, ever since I was a child.
I can only sleep in total darkness, usually with my head buried under something.
I can’t resist expensive gemstones. They must be mine!
I get overly obsessed with tunnelling, always wanting to dig deeper.
I’m surprisingly destructive – getting to the rocks is what matters, things in the way be damned!
I have no regard for the laws of the land when it comes to my research.
My only loyalty is to whoever is paying me for my work.

background.name: Time-Lost

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: a bone-dagger, club, simple loin cloth, {@item herbalism kit|PHB}, a {@item gold|PHB} necklace worth 30 gp., and a pair of  {@item gold|PHB} bracelets worth 7 gp. each.

entries: The time-lost are those unfortunate individuals who have been propelled through time, either by accident or  against their will. They find themselves in a strange land, surrounded by unfamiliar cultures and creatures.
{@variantrule Skill|PHB} proficiencies: {@skill Survival} and {@skill Nature}.
Tool proficiencies: {@item Leatherworker's tools|PHB} and  Survivalist's Kit.

entries.name: Suggested Feats and Ability Scores
entries: If you use your background to determine your ability score increases and provide a starting feat, we recommend the following:

entries.name: Feat:
entries: Alert or Naturalist (page 292).

entries.name: Ability Scores:
entries: +2 Constitution, +1 Wisdom or Strength.

entries.name: Survivalist's Kit:
entries: COMMON, 1 gp., 9 lb. This kit is used to carefully extract resources and medicines from plants and  animals. It consists of a small flint-knapped blade, wooden tweezers, water-proof pouches, and adhesives. The kit provides expertise with {@skill Medicine} checks, so long as you are in an environment with abundant plants/animals/fungi.

entries.name: Environmental Origin
entries: In your previous time, you inhabited a particular environment and are most familiar with that terrain type.
Roll a {@dice d8} and consult the table below or choose whichever you find most appealing.

rows: Jungle. You are unbothered by trekking through thick undergrowth.
Forest. You have a fondness of foraging for wild berries in forests.
Desert. The desert sun feels wonderful on your face and you like to bask in it.
Tundra. Getting chilly outside makes for a warmer, more welcoming, hearth at home.
Mountainous. You enjoy taking the difficult route, so long as it gives the best view.
Riverside. Catching fish is one of your favourite pastimes and is second nature to you
Seafaring. You love diving and collect exotic shells you find on the seafloor.
Plains. You always enjoy the calming breeze blowing across the plains.

entries.name: Feature: Way of the Wild
entries: While in an environment that is the same type as your origin, you are not slowed by {@quickref difficult terrain||3} generated by that environment.

entries.name: Characteristics
entries: The time-lost come from many different periods of time, environments, and cultures. However, they all share a lack of knowledge of the modern world. How they respond to that lack of knowledge differs-they may find things frightening, exciting, or uninteresting.

rows: I’m fearful of new technologies.
I love to collect beautiful feathers and adorn my clothes/armour with them.
Gold is commonplace to me, and I find it boring.
I find slaying certain creatures reprehensible.
I venerate creatures of great power
Every new piece of technology is extremely interesting to me, but also confusing.
The sounds of a city keep me awake at night.
I keep the teeth of monsters I slay on a necklace or bracelet.
I see myself as nature’s protector. I want to bond with and protect the modern wilds.
I see myself as an explorer and there are so many new things to discover!
I’m an expert hunter. I want to find this time’s most dangerous beast, and hunt it!
I’d like to return home. I need to learn about time travel and how I got here.
I seek to gain as much power and prominence as I can in this new time.
I miss the good ol’ days. I want to change this world to be more like my time.
I must find a way to return to my time.
My ancestors are out there somewhere. I must find them and reunite.
This new world is so strange, I’d like to explore what it has become.
There’s a bounty of wealth that I never could have imagined, I’d like to sample it.
I’m the last of my kin. I must re-establish my clan/tribe.
I left without settling a score. I must find out whether my old enemy was destroyed.
In my savage world, those who fell behind were left behind. I keep to this code.
I’m fearful of technology, it seems like evil magic to me.
I’m from a violent time, I act quickly and violently, worrying about consequences later
I’m naive about the dangers of this world.
I think these modern comforts make people weak.
I’m gluttonous with the bounty of all this exotic food!

book.name: Dr. Dhrolin's Dictionary of Dinosaurs
book.author: Dr Nathan T. Barling & Dr Michael O’Sullivan

trait.name: Overview
entries: Giraffatitan has advantage on {@skill Perception|PHB} checks that involve sight.

trait.name: Enormous
entries: Giraffatitan has resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage (included above). Giraffatitan has advantage on saving throws to resist being knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition paralyzed}, but automatically fails any Dexterity saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Giraffatitan chooses the attack action, it may make one Neck Sweep attack and one Chomp attack.

action.name: Neck Sweep
entries: {@atk mw} +10, reach 15 ft., up to three targets. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} +10, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Giraffatitan's CR to 11 and increase its XP to 7,200 accordingly.

entries.name: Evolutionary Arms Race
entries: Each time Giraffatitan is hit by an attack or fails a saving throw, roll on the Minor Mutation Table (Page 128) and apply the result to Giraffatitan, rerolling if Giraffatitan already has the effect that the mutation would confer.
Alternatively, instead of using the Minor Mutation Table you may increase the range of both of Giraffatitan's attacks by 5 ft.
Giraffatitan gains the mutation or increased attack range for 1 hour.

items.name: Evolutionary Arms Race
entries: Each time Giraffatitan is hit by an attack or fails a saving throw, roll on the Minor Mutation Table (page 128) and apply the result to Giraffatitan, rerolling if Giraffatitan already has the effect that the mutation would confer.
Alternatively, instead of using the Minor Mutation Table you may increase the range of both of Giraffatitan's attacks by 5 ft.
Giraffatitan gains the mutation or increased attack range for 1 hour.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small beast. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

The swarm is immune to being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition grappled}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained}, and {@condition stunned} (included above).

trait.name: High-Gait Scramble {@recharge 4}
entries: Garjainia (Swarm) can dash as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Garjainia (Swarm) chooses the attack action, it may make four Over-Sized Bite attacks.

action.name: Over-Sized Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d4 + 2} piercing damage and be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change Garjainia (Swarm)'s CR

entries.name: Power Syphon
entries: Each time a creature is hit by Over-Sized Bite attack, roll a d20. On a roll of 1-10, nothing happens. On a roll of 11-20, the hit creature expends one unused spell slot (determined at random).

items.name: Power Syphon
entries: Each time a creature is hit by Over-Sized Bite attack, roll a d20. On a roll of 1-10, nothing happens. On a roll of 11-20, the hit creature expends one unused spell slot (determined at random).

trait.name: Lock Jaw
entries: If Garjainia hits a creature with its Over-Sized Bite attack, it can opt to grasp onto it. While grasping, if either Garjainia or the hit creature attempts to move, they must make contested Strength checks. Whichever creature loses the contested Strength check has its speed reduced to 0 until its next turn. If Garjainia or the grasped creature moves, the other moves with it (without using any of its own movement) and is considered to be occupying the same space as it.
As an action, the hit creature may make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw to remove Garjainia, ending this effect and pushing Garjainia 5 ft. directly away from it on a success.
Alternatively, Garjainia may choose to end this effect at any time.

trait.name: High-Gait Scramble {@recharge 4}
entries: Garjainia can dash as a bonus action.

action.name: Over-Sized Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.
When a creature is hit by this attack, roll a {@dice d3} and consult the list below, applying the effect to the hit creature so long as Garjainia is grasping it (see Lock Jaw).
1. Bitten body. The creature suffers an additional 4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage at the start of its turn.
2. Bitten arm. Melee, ranged, and spell attacks made by the creature are at disadvantage.
3. Bitten leg. Halve the current speed of the creature.
Garjainia can only cause one of these effects at a time.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change Garjainia's CR

entries.name: Piranha-like Swarm
entries: If you wish, you may treat a group of 4-5 Garjainia as a CR 6 swarm (see the Garjainia (Swarm) stat block).

entries.name: Power Syphon
entries: Each time a creature is hit by Over-Sized Bite attack, roll a d20. On a roll of 1-10, nothing happens. On a roll of 11-20, the hit creature expends one unused spell slot (determined at random).

items.name: Piranha-like Swarm
entries: Each time a creature is hit by Over-Sized Bite attack, roll a d20. On a roll of 1-10, nothing happens. On a roll of 11-20, the hit creature expends one unused spell slot (determined at random).

items.name: Power Syphon
entries: Each time a creature is hit by Over-Sized Bite attack, roll a d20. On a roll of 1-10, nothing happens. On a roll of 11-20, the hit creature expends one unused spell slot (determined at random).

trait.name: Fruitbringer
entries: When Falcatakely is first encountered, it will always carry a berry or fruit in its mouth. If players approach it, it will fly to a nearby tree or bush, revealing an abundance of delicious fruits/berries that can provide rations for four people for up to two days.

trait.name: Morning Chorus
entries: As dawn breaks, Falcatakely makes loud chirping noises that can be heard for up to 300 ft.

trait.name: Island Isolation
entries: Falcatakely found on an island will be different colours from, and produce a different chorus to, those found on the mainland.

action.name: Recurved Peck
entries: {@atk mw} +2, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d2}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change Falcatakely's CR

entries.name: Bountiful Harvest
entries: Falcatakely radiate druidic energies and their presence increases the yield of all surrounding plants. If Falcatakely is present in an environment for more than a week, all plants in the local region double the amount of fruit, berries, and flowers they produce. This effect diminishes and productivity returns to normal over the course of a week if Falcatakely leaves the area.
Islands inhabited by colonies of many Falcatakely are usually tropical paradises.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: Falcatakely may be used as a familiar via the {@spell Find Familiar|PHB} spell or any similar effect. If you do so, we recommend that its Fruitbringer ability only activates each time it is summoned in a new area.

items.name: Bountiful Harvest
entries: Falcatakely radiate druidic energies and their presence increases the yield of all surrounding plants. If Falcatakely is present in an environment for more than a week, all plants in the local region double the amount of fruit, berries, and flowers they produce. This effect diminishes and productivity returns to normal over the course of a week if Falcatakely leaves the area.
Islands inhabited by colonies of many Falcatakely are usually tropical paradises.

items.name: Familiar
entries: Falcatakely may be used as a familiar via the {@spell Find Familiar|PHB} spell or any similar effect. If you do so, we recommend that its Fruitbringer ability only activates each time it is summoned in a new area.

trait.name: Top Triassic Predator
entries: Erythrosuchus was the top predator of its time, but only predated upon animals a similar size or smaller than itself.
Erythrosuchus has advantage on attacks against Medium and Large creatures, but disadvantage on attacks against creatures of any other size category.
Semi-arid Inhabitant. Erythrosuchus only needs to drink water once every few weeks.

trait.name: Unknown Predatory Style
entries: If Erythrosuchus chooses the dash action, it may still make a single attack with its Monstrous Jaw as a bonus action.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Erythrosuchus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Erythrosuchus chooses the attack action, it may make two Monstrous Jaw attacks.

action.name: Monstrous Jaw
entries: {@atk mw} +6, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage.
A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). While Erythrosuchus is grappling a creature, it can only target that creature with its attacks

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Ripping Thrash. Erythrosuchus thrashes from side to side. If it is currently grappling a creature in its jaws, that creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} slashing damage. On a success, they take half as much damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Drag Away. Erythrosuchus may move up to 20 ft., dragging a {@condition grappled} creature along with it. Any creature {@condition grappled} by Erythrosuchus is moved with it.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Erythrosuchus' CR to 9 and increase its XP to 5000 accordingly.

entries.name: Maw of Madness
entries: Any creature hit by Erythrosuchus' Monstrous Jaw attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or have their Intelligence score temporarily reduced to 3 for 1 minute. During this time, they may only act on instincts, their proficiency bonus is 0, and they cannot speak, read, write, or understand language.

items.name: Maw of Madness
entries: Any creature hit by Erythrosuchus' Monstrous Jaw attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or have their Intelligence score temporarily reduced to 3 for 1 minute. During this time, they may only act on instincts, their proficiency bonus is 0, and they cannot speak, read, write, or understand language.

trait.name: Hyper Resilience
entries: Deinosuchus' remarkable immune system and colossal bulk render it resistant to all damage and it is immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition (included above).

trait.name: Devourer of Giants
entries: Any creature with a size of Large or larger makes saving throws at disadvantage against Deinosuchus' Bone-Crushing Bite.

trait.name: Aquatic Ambush Predator
entries: Deinosuchus can hold its breath for up to 1 hour and has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks while submerged in water.

action.name: Bone-Crushing Bite
entries: Deinosuchus may attempt a Bone-Crushing Bite against one creature within 10 ft. of it. This bite is so powerful that armour is essentially useless. The target creature must succeed a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 56 ({@damage 8d10 + 12}) piercing damage, be {@condition grappled}, and {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 20}). Deinosuchus then cannot select a different target for Bone-Crushing Bite until the grapple ends.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Thrash. Deinosuchus may thrash around wildly.

All creatures within 10 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 2d20}) bludgeoning damage. A creature {@condition grappled} by Deinosuchus may not attempt to save against this damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Deathroll. If Deinosuchus is grappling another creature that is Large or larger, it may perform a Deathroll. The {@condition grappled} creature must succeed a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw or take 39 ({@damage 6d12}) force damage. On a success they take half as much damage. Deinosuchus cannot use Deathroll next round.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change Deinosuchus' CR.

entries.name: Regional Demigod
entries: Deinosuchus is worshiped by local humanoids as the embodiment of primal power and is accompanied by an entourage of humanoids that adorn it with giant flower rings, vividly coloured paints, and fine silks, and ritualistically clean its teeth as it basks in the sun.

Deinosuchus will not attack humanoids unless in self-defence and it is considered an extreme offence to these people to disrespect or attack Deinosuchus. Typically, these humanoids will demand an offering of food for Deinosuchus to safely pass through its territory.

items.name: Regional Demigod
entries: Deinosuchus is worshiped by local humanoids as the embodiment of primal power and is accompanied by an entourage of humanoids that adorn it with giant flower rings, vividly coloured paints, and fine silks, and ritualistically clean its teeth as it basks in the sun.

Deinosuchus will not attack humanoids unless in self-defence and it is considered an extreme offence to these people to disrespect or attack Deinosuchus. Typically, these humanoids will demand an offering of food for Deinosuchus to safely pass through its territory.

trait.name: Wader
entries: Deinocheirus can move through water up to 6 ft. deep without being slowed or having to swim.

trait.name: Pennaceous Display Feathers
entries: Deinocheirus has advantage on {@skill Intimidation} and {@skill Persuasion} checks.

trait.name: Mud Raker
entries: If a single creature is hit by both of Deinocheirus' Terrible Claw attacks in a single turn, they suffer an additional {@damage 1d6} poison damage, as the dregged mud from its claws coats their wounds.

trait.name: Grasping Tongue
entries: As a bonus action, Deinocheirus may pick up and wield an item (up to 20 lb.) with its tongue. If that item is a weapon and does not require ammunition, it may make an attack with it as a bonus action on its subsequent turns, although it is not proficient with it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: When selecting the attack action, Deinocheirus may make two Terrible Claw attacks.

action.name: Terrible Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d12 + 3}) slashing damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or drop an item they are wielding.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Deinocheirus' CR to 8 and increase its XP to 3900 accordingly.

entries.name: Swamp Lord
entries: Deinocheirus gains resistance to cold and poison damage.

entries.name: Swampy Vomit {@recharge 5}
entries: As an action, Deinocheirus vomits swampy water in a 40 ft. line that is 5 ft. wide. Each creature in that line must succeed a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} poison damage and {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

items.name: Swamp Lord
entries: Deinocheirus gains resistance to cold and poison damage.

items.name: Swampy Vomit {@recharge 5}
entries: As an action, Deinocheirus vomits swampy water in a 40 ft. line that is 5 ft. wide. Each creature in that line must succeed a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} poison damage and {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

trait.name: Mysterious Hump: Micro-thermoregulation
entries: When hit by an attack or when failing a saving throw, Concavenator can use its reaction to gain resistance to fire or cold damage until the end of the turn.

trait.name: Mysterious Hump: Display
entries: Concavenator has advantage on Charisma checks.

trait.name: Mysterious Hump: Fatty Storage
entries: Concavenator only needs to drink once per month.

trait.name: Muscular Forearms
entries: Concavenator has advantage on any Strength checks to avoid being {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Combined Claw and Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Concavenators' CR to 4 and increase its XP to 1100 accordingly.

entries.name: Landshark
entries: Concavenator gains a tremorsense of 30 ft. and a burrowing speed of 30 ft., but cannot burrow through solid stone. While burrowing, it gains resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and is heavily obscured (although its general location is revealed by its protruding hump, which glides along the ground).

entries.name: Burrowing Dive
entries: As an action, Concavenator may burrow downwards to go deeper underground, preparing to strike its next target. While burrowing deeper underground, it is entirely obscured and cannot attack or be attacked, except when attacking/attacked by another burrowing creature.

On its next turn, Concavenator can burst upwards, unearthing itself and ending its burrowing. If it does so, it has advantage on attack rolls until the end of its turn, but cannot use the Burrowing Dive ability again until the start of its next turn

items.name: Landshark
entries: Concavenator gains a tremorsense of 30 ft. and a burrowing speed of 30 ft., but cannot burrow through solid stone. While burrowing, it gains resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and is heavily obscured (although its general location is revealed by its protruding hump, which glides along the ground).

items.name: Burrowing Dive
entries: As an action, Concavenator may burrow downwards to go deeper underground, preparing to strike its next target. While burrowing deeper underground, it is entirely obscured and cannot attack or be attacked, except when attacking/attacked by another burrowing creature.

On its next turn, Concavenator can burst upwards, unearthing itself and ending its burrowing. If it does so, it has advantage on attack rolls until the end of its turn, but cannot use the Burrowing Dive ability again until the start of its next turn

trait.name: Frill Shield
entries: If Centrosaurus is facing the direction that an attack originated from, increase Centrosaurus' AC by 2 against that attack.

trait.name: Dazzling Display
entries: As a bonus action, Centrosaurus may flood its frill with blood, creating a bright colourful display. All enemy creatures within 30 ft. of Centrosaurus that can see it must succeed a {@dc 10} Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on saving throws for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Tenacious Herbivore
entries: Centrosaurus has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

action.name: Horn Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} +5, reach 5 ft., up to two targets. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horn Charge
entries: {@atk mw} +8, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 8}) piercing damage.
Centrosaurus may only use this attack if it moved at least 20 ft. in a straight line before reaching the target on this turn.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Centrosaurus' CR to 4 and increase its XP to 1100 accordingly.

entries.name: Mirror Image:
entries: Monoclonius (1/day). As a bonus action, Centrosaurus can cast {@spell Mirror Image} at 2nd level without requiring components or a spell slot. Each of the illusions is of an extremely similar, perhaps identical, dinosaur called Monoclonius and persist for 24 hours (rather than 1 minute).
When approaching a herd of Centrosaurus, at least one will already have this spell active.

items.name: Mirror Image:
entries: Monoclonius (1/day). As a bonus action, Centrosaurus can cast {@spell Mirror Image} at 2nd level without requiring components or a spell slot. Each of the illusions is of an extremely similar, perhaps identical, dinosaur called Monoclonius and persist for 24 hours (rather than 1 minute).
When approaching a herd of Centrosaurus, at least one will already have this spell active.

trait.name: Dorsal Sail
entries: As a bonus action, Arizonasaurus can flush its sail with blood, giving it advantage on {@skill Intimidation} checks for 1 minute

trait.name: Sail Reliant Reptilian Metabolism
entries: During the day, Arizonasaurus is resistant to cold damage. During the night, Arizonasaurus is resistant to fire damage.

action.name: Bite and Shake
entries: {@atk mw} +5, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d6} slashing damage and, if they are Medium or smaller, are {@condition grappled} until the start of Arizonasaurus' next turn.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Arizonasaurus' CR to 2 and increase its XP to 450 accordingly.

entries.name: Arizona Heat
entries: Arizonasaurus radiates incredible heat. Any creature that starts its turn within or comes within 20 ft. of Arizonasaurus immediately suffers {@damage 1d6} fire damage. This is increased to {@dice 2d6} if they are within 5 ft. of Arizonasaurus.
Additionally, Arizonasaurus is immune to fire damage.
If there are multiple Arizonasaurus persisting in a region with this ability, that region will experience a prolonged drought.

items.name: Arizona Heat
entries: Arizonasaurus radiates incredible heat. Any creature that starts its turn within or comes within 20 ft. of Arizonasaurus immediately suffers {@damage 1d6} fire damage. This is increased to {@dice 2d6} if they are within 5 ft. of Arizonasaurus.
Additionally, Arizonasaurus is immune to fire damage.
If there are multiple Arizonasaurus persisting in a region with this ability, that region will experience a prolonged drought.

trait.name: Filamentous Integument Mane
entries: "Ubirajara" has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks while in foliage and, when hit by an attack, can use its reaction to reduce any bludgeoning or piercing damage it would take from that attack by half.
"Ubirajara" also gains a +5 bonus to {@skill Intimidation} checks (included above).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If "Ubirajara" chooses the attack action, it may make three Gnashing Nip attacks.

action.name: Gnashing Nip
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change "Ubirajara"'s CR.

entries.name: Lord of Spears
entries: "Ubirajara" can alternatively make a single ranged attack whereby it fires spears of filamentous integument at a creature with the following profile:

entries.name: Filamentous Spear
entries: {@atk rw} +5, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

entries.name: Return Home (1/Day)
entries: As an action, "Ubirajara" can attempt to return back to its home. It opens an interplanar portal 10 ft. in front of itself. The portal leads to a destination that it considers to be home anywhere in the multiverse and remains open for 1 minute or until "Ubirajara" falls {@condition unconscious}. The portal is big enough to allow creatures up to a size of Large through it.

items.name: Lord of Spears
entries: "Ubirajara" can alternatively make a single ranged attack whereby it fires spears of filamentous integument at a creature with the following profile:

items.name: Filamentous Spear
entries: {@atk rw} +5, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

items.name: Return Home (1/Day)
entries: As an action, "Ubirajara" can attempt to return back to its home. It opens an interplanar portal 10 ft. in front of itself. The portal leads to a destination that it considers to be home anywhere in the multiverse and remains open for 1 minute or until "Ubirajara" falls {@condition unconscious}. The portal is big enough to allow creatures up to a size of Large through it.

trait.name: Storm Flyer
entries: Tupandactylus has resistance to lightning and thunder damage (included above).

trait.name: Focused on Flirting
entries: If Tupandactylus performed a Dazzling Display or Thundering Display, it has disadvantage on {@skill Perception} checks for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Quad Launch (Tupandactylus)
entries: If not already flying, as a bonus action, Tupandactylus can launch itself into the air.

Every other creature within 5 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Tupandactylus then begins to fly and must fly 20 ft. in a straight line (either horizontally, or vertically up).
Tupandactylus can only begin flying by using this ability, or if it is falling.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Tupandactylus chooses the attack action, it may make two attacks with its Beak-Slash attack.

action.name: Beak-Slash
entries: {@atk mw} +6, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dazzling Display
entries: As an action, Tupandactylus can perform a Dazzling Display. Performing the display gives Tupandactylus advantage on all Charisma saving throws and checks for the next 1 minute.

Additionally, any creature within 20 ft. and line of sight of Tupandactylus must try and avert their gaze. They must succeed a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or have disadvantage on all Charisma saving throws and checks for the next 1 minute.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Tupandactylus's CR to 3 and increase its XP to 700 accordingly.

entries.name: Tupi Thunder God
entries: Tupandactylus takes its name from the Tupi Thunder God. Tupandactylus is immune to thunder damage and its Beak-Slash attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} thunder damage.

entries.name: Thundering Display {@recharge 3}
entries: As an action, Tupandactylus can channel the power of thunder, generating a shockwave by suddenly vibrating its wings.

All other creatures within 15 ft. must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} thunder damage and attack with disadvantage until the end of their next turn. On a successful save they take half as much damage and are otherwise unaffected.

items.name: Tupi Thunder God
entries: Tupandactylus takes its name from the Tupi Thunder God. Tupandactylus is immune to thunder damage and its Beak-Slash attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} thunder damage.

items.name: Thundering Display {@recharge 3}
entries: As an action, Tupandactylus can channel the power of thunder, generating a shockwave by suddenly vibrating its wings.

All other creatures within 15 ft. must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} thunder damage and attack with disadvantage until the end of their next turn. On a successful save they take half as much damage and are otherwise unaffected.

items.name: Beak-Slash
entries: {@atk mw} +6, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage + {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) thunder damage.

trait.name: Tiny Squiggly Wriggly
entries: So long as Tetrapodophis is in water, attacks against it are made at disadvantage, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and if it would take half damage after succeeding a Dexterity saving throw it instead takes none.

trait.name: Re-interpretation
entries: You may opt for Tetrapodophis to have a burrowing speed of 10 ft. instead of a swim speed.

action.name: Vicious Tiny Nip
entries: {@atk mw} +1, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 (1) piercing damage

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Tetrapodophis' CR to 1/2 and increase its XP to 100 accordingly.

entries.name: Deadly Snake-like Venom
entries: Tetrapodophis is brightly coloured with stripes or other patterns warning of its venomous nature. Any creature hit by Tetrapodophis' Vicious Tiny Nip attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d6 + 1} poison damage, gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}, and become {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours. On a successful save, they take no additional poison damage, but still gain a level of {@condition exhaustion} and become {@condition poisoned}.
A creature cannot exceed more than four levels of {@condition exhaustion} from this ability.

items.name: Deadly Snake-like Venom
entries: Tetrapodophis is brightly coloured with stripes or other patterns warning of its venomous nature. Any creature hit by Tetrapodophis' Vicious Tiny Nip attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d6 + 1} poison damage, gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}, and become {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours. On a successful save, they take no additional poison damage, but still gain a level of {@condition exhaustion} and become {@condition poisoned}.
A creature cannot exceed more than four levels of {@condition exhaustion} from this ability.

trait.name: Death by Yucca
entries: Any creatures composed of or based on plants have advantage on attacks against Ludodactylus.

trait.name: Piscivorous Snatch Feeder
entries: Ludodactylus has advantage on attacks against creatures fully or partially submerged in water. If Ludodactylus is flying, it does not provoke attacks of opportunity when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: When Ludodactylus selects the attack action, it may make two attacks with its Toothed-Beak Bite and one Projectile Vomit attack.

action.name: Toothed-Beak Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Projectile Vomit
entries: {@atk rw} +6, range 15 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) acid damage.

action.name: Snatch
entries: As an action, so long as it is flying, Ludodactylus may attempt to snatch an item being held by a creature or it may attempt to snatch a small item attached to a player's belt (i.e. a potion or small bag). The target creature must succeed a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or Ludodactylus plucks the item from them and holds it in its beak.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Ludoactylus' CR to 4 and increase its XP to 1100 accordingly.

entries.name: Quad Launch (Ludodactylus)
entries: If not already flying, as a bonus action, Ludodactylus can launch itself into the air.

Every other creature within 5 ft. of Ludodactylus must succeed a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Ludodactylus then begins to fly and must fly 15 ft. in a straight line (either horizontally, or vertically up).
Ludodactylus can only begin flying by using this ability, or if it is falling.

entries.name: Bred for War
entries: Ludodactylus have been specially bred for combat. It can be equipped with heavy armour, increasing their AC to 18, but its fly speed is reduced to 35 ft. Ludodactylus takes on a heavily armoured appearance.
Ludodactylus can also be mounted by any small humanoid. If it is mounted by an NPC, they are armed with a lance and Ludodactylus can use its bonus action to make one of the following attacks:

entries.name: Mounted Lance
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) piercing damage.

entries.name: Lancing Projectile
entries: {@atk rw} +7, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) force damage.

items.name: Quad Launch (Ludodactylus)
entries: If not already flying, as a bonus action, Ludodactylus can launch itself into the air.

Every other creature within 5 ft. of Ludodactylus must succeed a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Ludodactylus then begins to fly and must fly 15 ft. in a straight line (either horizontally, or vertically up).
Ludodactylus can only begin flying by using this ability, or if it is falling.

items.name: Bred for War
entries: Ludodactylus have been specially bred for combat. It can be equipped with heavy armour, increasing their AC to 18, but its fly speed is reduced to 35 ft. Ludodactylus takes on a heavily armoured appearance.
Ludodactylus can also be mounted by any small humanoid. If it is mounted by an NPC, they are armed with a lance and Ludodactylus can use its bonus action to make one of the following attacks:

items.name: Mounted Lance
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) piercing damage.

items.name: Lancing Projectile
entries: {@atk rw} +7, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) force damage.

trait.name: Charming Display (2/Day)
entries: Cratoavis can cast the spell {@spell Charm Person} with a spell save DC of 15. A {@condition charmed} humanoid must attempt to provide food to Cratoavis.

trait.name: Swooping Flight
entries: So long as Cratoavis is flying and it moved last turn, its AC is increased by 3 and it does not provoke attacks of opportunity when it moves out of reach from an enemy.

action.name: Toothed Peck
entries: {@atk mw} +2, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d2 + 1}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change Cratoavis' CR

entries.name: Global Adventurer
entries: If Cratoavis successfully charms a member of the party, it will then begin to follow the party if able, keeping a reasonable distance from them (>50 ft.) for most of the time.
Unless it is regularly fed, once per day it will attempt to perform a Charming Display to either a party member or another humanoid it encounters.

entries.name: Perfect Preservation
entries: If Cratoavis is slain, its body does not decay or deteriorate in any way, and it instead enters a state of preservational stasis.
While in this state, it is {@condition unconscious} and can be revived by receiving any healing from a magical source

items.name: Global Adventurer
entries: If Cratoavis successfully charms a member of the party, it will then begin to follow the party if able, keeping a reasonable distance from them (>50 ft.) for most of the time.
Unless it is regularly fed, once per day it will attempt to perform a Charming Display to either a party member or another humanoid it encounters.

items.name: Perfect Preservation
entries: If Cratoavis is slain, its body does not decay or deteriorate in any way, and it instead enters a state of preservational stasis.
While in this state, it is {@condition unconscious} and can be revived by receiving any healing from a magical source

trait.name: Peaceful Aura, Fearsome Presence
entries: Beipiaosaurus is a docile creature, calmly feeding on vegetation in the chilly mountains of Yixian. However, if attacked, Beipiaosaurus will erupt into a frenzy of slashing claws. The first time Beipiaosaurus is attacked, the attacking creature must succeed a {@dc 12} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of Beipiaosaurus until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Slow Metabolism
entries: Beipiaosaurus has advantage on saving throws to prevent the {@condition poisoned} condition. However, if it does become {@condition poisoned}, the duration of that condition is doubled.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Beipiaosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make two Sabre-Clawed Slash attacks.

action.name: Sabre-Clawed Slash
entries: {@atk mw} +5, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} additional slashing damage.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Beipiaosaurus' CR to 3 and increase its XP to 700 accordingly.

entries.name: Predatory Ancestors
entries: Beipiaosaurus retains the nocturnal hunter-killer instincts of its predatory theropod ancestors.
At night, Beipiaosaurus gains the following temporary changes:
- It has darkvision 60 ft.
- Its movement speed is 35 ft. and its climb speed is 20 ft.
- It has advantage on {@skill Perception} checks.
- It has resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
- It has vulnerability to radiant damage.
- It has an aversion to bright light.
- It loses its "Peaceful Aura, Fearsome Presence" ability.

items.name: Predatory Ancestors
entries: Beipiaosaurus retains the nocturnal hunter-killer instincts of its predatory theropod ancestors.
At night, Beipiaosaurus gains the following temporary changes:
- It has darkvision 60 ft.
- Its movement speed is 35 ft. and its climb speed is 20 ft.
- It has advantage on {@skill Perception} checks.
- It has resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
- It has vulnerability to radiant damage.
- It has an aversion to bright light.
- It loses its "Peaceful Aura, Fearsome Presence" ability.

trait.name: Stout Body
entries: Zalmoxes' unusually stout body makes it remarkably tough for its size. It has resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning damage (included above).

trait.name: Docile and Cowardly
entries: Zalmoxes will not attack unless provoked. It will flee from creatures it perceives as predators.

action.name: Beaked Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change Zalmoxes' CR.

entries.name: Shrieking Demise
entries: When Zalmoxes is reduced to 0 hit points it lets out a cowardly shriek. This shriek afflicts the creature that inflicted lethal damage to Zalmoxes. That creature is cursed by Reverberation of Cowardice.

entries.name: Curse: Reverberation of Cowardice
entries: A creature cursed by Reverberation of Cowardice must succeed a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw each time it enters combat or be {@condition frightened} of all enemies for 1 minute.
The creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the {@condition frightened} condition (until it re-enters combat).
This curse can be removed by a {@spell Lesser Restoration} spell or similar effect, or ends after 24 hours.

items.name: Shrieking Demise
entries: When Zalmoxes is reduced to 0 hit points it lets out a cowardly shriek. This shriek afflicts the creature that inflicted lethal damage to Zalmoxes. That creature is cursed by Reverberation of Cowardice.

items.name: Curse: Reverberation of Cowardice
entries: A creature cursed by Reverberation of Cowardice must succeed a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw each time it enters combat or be {@condition frightened} of all enemies for 1 minute.
The creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the {@condition frightened} condition (until it re-enters combat).
This curse can be removed by a {@spell Lesser Restoration} spell or similar effect, or ends after 24 hours.

trait.name: Bladed Osteoderms
entries: Any creature that hits Struthiosaurus with a melee attack suffers {@damage 1d4} slashing damage.

action.name: Defensive Stance
entries: As an action, Struthiosaurus may take up a defensive stance, lowering its head and limbs, only allowing its armoured back to be attacked. This stance lasts until it attacks. Struthiosaurus gains resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage while in a defensive stance.

action.name: Armoured Tackle
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change Struthiosaurus' CR

entries.name: Rainbow Osteoderms
entries: When hit by an attack or failing a saving throw, as a reaction and while in a Defensive Stance, Struthiosaurus may swap one of its resistances from bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing to any other one resistance type. While it has that resistance, its Bladed Osteoderms deal an additional {@damage 1d2} damage of that damage type. This resistance is lost if it attacks.

items.name: Rainbow Osteoderms
entries: When hit by an attack or failing a saving throw, as a reaction and while in a Defensive Stance, Struthiosaurus may swap one of its resistances from bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing to any other one resistance type. While it has that resistance, its Bladed Osteoderms deal an additional {@damage 1d2} damage of that damage type. This resistance is lost if it attacks.

trait.name: Sweeping Defence
entries: When hit by a melee attack, Magyarosaurus may use its reaction to make a Neck Bludgeon attack against the creature that attacked it.

trait.name: Pint-Sized Powerhouse
entries: Magyarosaurus has advantage on Strength saving throws.

action.name: Rear Up
entries: As an action, Magyarosaurus can rear up onto its hind limbs. If it does, its speed is reduced to 10 ft. and it is able to use its Mighty Stomp attack until it is no longer rearing up.
If Magyarosaurus takes the attack action, or makes an attack of opportunity as a reaction, it lands on all fours and it ceases rearing up.

action.name: Neck Bludgeon
entries: {@atk mw} +8, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Mighty Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} +8, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 6d6 + 12}) bludgeoning damage.
Magyarosaurus must be rearing up to use this attack.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Magyarosaurus' CR to 5 and increase its XP to 1800 accordingly.

entries.name: Dynamic Camouflage (2/Day)
entries: As an action, Magyarosaurus can cast {@spell Invisibility} at 2nd level on itself without requiring components or a spell slot.

items.name: Dynamic Camouflage (2/Day)
entries: As an action, Magyarosaurus can cast {@spell Invisibility} at 2nd level on itself without requiring components or a spell slot.

trait.name: Crop
entries: Hatzegopteryx has a large throat pouch called a crop that is able to hold a Medium or smaller sized creature.
Creatures inside this crop are {@condition restrained} and suffer {@damage 4d4} bludgeoning damage at the start of their turn. There is only enough air within the crop to breathe for 1 minute.
While a creature is inside it's crop, Hatzegopteryx's fly speed is reduced by half, it cannot dash, and it will generally attempt to flee a fight to keep its meal.
A swallowed creature may attempt to escape by making a {@dc 17} Strength check. On a success, they are regurgitated.
Alternatively, if Hatzegopteryx falls below 100 hit points, they are regurgitated.

trait.name: Evasive Flying
entries: If Hatzegopteryx makes a Dexterity saving throw while flying to take only half damage from an attack, spell, or effect, it instead takes no damage if the saving throw is succeeded.
Hatzegopteryx cannot make Dexterity saving throws against attacks, spells, or effects that originated from within its crop.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Hatzegopteryx fails a saving throw, it may instead choose to succeed.

trait.name: Swallow
entries: So long as Hatzegopteryx has at least 100 hit points, as a bonus action it may attempt to swallow a creature that is lying {@condition prone}. The creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (their choice) or be swallowed into Hatzegopteryx's crop.

trait.name: Heavy Flier
entries: Hatzegopteryx can only begin flying by using its Quad Launch Legendary Action, or if it is falling.
Hatzegopteryx is also immune to thunder damage (included above).

action.name: Grounded Multiattack
entries: If Hatzegopteryx chooses the attack action while standing on the ground, it may make one Beak Spear attack and two Beak Flurry attacks.

action.name: Beak Spear
entries: {@atk mw} +8, reach 10 ft., one target.{@h}30 ({@damage 5d8 + 8}) piercing damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Beak Flurry
entries: {@atk mw} +12, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.
A target hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Quad Launch (Hatzegopteryx).
Hatzegopteryx launches itself into the air. Every other creature within 10 ft. of Hatzegopteryx must succeed a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
Hatzegopteryx then begins to fly and must fly 20 ft. in a straight line (either horizontally, or vertically up).
Hatzegopteryx cannot use this Legendary Action next battle round.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Hatzegopteryx's CR to 18 and increase its XP to 20000 accordingly.

entries.name: Sonic Shockwave (1/Day)
entries: Hatzegopteryx may choose to forgo its action and bonus action this round. If it does so, its fly speed is increased to 600 ft. and, if it moves its maximum fly distance in a straight line, it may emit a Sonic Shockwave at any point along that route.
When it does, each other creature within 120 ft. of Hatzegopteryx must succeed a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 12d8} thunder damage. On a success they take half as much damage.
Hatzegopteryx may only perform a Sonic Shockwave if there are no creatures in its crop.

entries.name: Unnatural Resistance
entries: Hatzegopteryx is resistant to both magical and non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage as well as cold, fire, and lightning damage.

entries.name: Legendary Action: Screech
entries: Hatzegopteryx lets out a harrowing screech. Each other creature within 60 ft. must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and be {@condition frightened} of Hatzegopteryx for 1 minute. A creature can make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, and on a success they are no longer {@condition frightened} of Hatzegopteryx and cannot be {@condition frightened} of it again for the next 24 hours.

items.name: Sonic Shockwave (1/Day)
entries: Hatzegopteryx may choose to forgo its action and bonus action this round. If it does so, its fly speed is increased to 600 ft. and, if it moves its maximum fly distance in a straight line, it may emit a Sonic Shockwave at any point along that route.
When it does, each other creature within 120 ft. of Hatzegopteryx must succeed a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 12d8} thunder damage. On a success they take half as much damage.
Hatzegopteryx may only perform a Sonic Shockwave if there are no creatures in its crop.

items.name: Unnatural Resistance
entries: Hatzegopteryx is resistant to both magical and non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage as well as cold, fire, and lightning damage.

items.name: Legendary Action: Screech
entries: Hatzegopteryx lets out a harrowing screech. Each other creature within 60 ft. must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and be {@condition frightened} of Hatzegopteryx for 1 minute. A creature can make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, and on a success they are no longer {@condition frightened} of Hatzegopteryx and cannot be {@condition frightened} of it again for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Ambush Predator
entries: Balaur has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks.

trait.name: Flutter-Leap
entries: Balaur can jump up to 30 ft. and is immune to falling damage.

action.name: Pair Bonding
entries: As an action, Balaur may give another allied Balaur within 60 ft. advantage on that Balaur's attacks and saving throws until the start of this Balaur's next turn.

action.name: Twin Claw Grapple
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 10} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} by Balaur.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Balaur's CR to 1 and increase its XP to 200 accordingly.

entries.name: Twin Spirited
entries: The first time Balaur is reduced to 0 hit points, so long as it used Pair Bonding at least once, or was the target of another Balaur's Pair Bonding, it is revived with full hit points although it has an ethereal ghost-like appearance. Its Twin Claw Grapple attack now deals necrotic damage instead of piercing.

items.name: Twin Spirited
entries: The first time Balaur is reduced to 0 hit points, so long as it used Pair Bonding at least once, or was the target of another Balaur's Pair Bonding, it is revived with full hit points although it has an ethereal ghost-like appearance. Its Twin Claw Grapple attack now deals necrotic damage instead of piercing.

trait.name: Aquatic
entries: Stomatosuchus has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks while submerged in water. It can hold its breath for up to 30 minutes.

trait.name: Size Matters
entries: Stomatosuchus will not attack a creature of Medium size or larger, unless to defend itself or its feeding grounds.

trait.name: Throat Pouch
entries: A creature within Stomatosuchus' throat pouch is {@condition restrained} and takes {@damage 2d4} bludgeoning damage at the start of each of their turns. At the end of its turn, the {@condition restrained} creature may attempt to escape by succeeding on a {@dc 14} Strength check.
If Stomatosuchus falls below half hit points, it will regurgitate any creature in its throat pouch. If a creature dies while in the throat pouch, Stomatosuchus swallows it.

trait.name: Crocodilian Immune System
entries: Stomatosuchus is resistant to poison damage and immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition (included above).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Stomatosuchus chooses the attack action, it may make one Needle Maw attack and one Tail Swipe attack.

action.name: Needle Maw
entries: {@atk mw} +8, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If Stomatosuchus' throat pouch is empty, it may attempt to swallow a Small or Tiny creature hit by this attack. The target must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be swallowed into Stomatosuchus' throat pouch.

action.name: Tail Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change Stomatosuchus' CR.

entries.name: Careless Swallow
entries: Stomatosuchus gulps huge volumes of water daily as it filters out tiny fish to devour. In doing so, it occasionally swallows small gemstones or trinkets that wash into the water. Roll a {@dice d6} and consult the list below, Stomatosuchus gains the corresponding effect.

1 - Gemstone. Select a damage type from lightning, cold, fire, or poison. Stomatosuchus' Needle Maw attack deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage of that type and also change the damage of its Throat Pouch to that type.
2 - Ring of Protection. Increase Stomatosuchus' AC by 1.
3 - Holy Symbol. Stomatosuchus gains immunity to radiant damage.
4 - Gold Coins. Stomatosuchus' throat pouch deals an additional {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and it regurgitates 100 gp when slain.

5 - Wand Shard. Stomatosuchus knows the Firebolt, Ray of Frost, or {@spell Thunderclap|XGE} cantrip. It can cast them as though it were level 5, its spell attack modifier is +4 and any saving throw from its cantrips has a DC of 14.
6 - Ticking Clock. Stomatosuchus loses its Size Matters ability and becomes exceptionally aggressive. It also constantly makes a faint ticking sound.

entries.name: Treasure Trove
entries: When Stomatosuchus is slain, it's throat pouch contains {@dice 1d4} trinkets, small items, or gemstones (DM's choice, typically including whatever is described above)

items.name: Careless Swallow
entries: Stomatosuchus gulps huge volumes of water daily as it filters out tiny fish to devour. In doing so, it occasionally swallows small gemstones or trinkets that wash into the water. Roll a {@dice d6} and consult the list below, Stomatosuchus gains the corresponding effect.

1 - Gemstone. Select a damage type from lightning, cold, fire, or poison. Stomatosuchus' Needle Maw attack deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage of that type and also change the damage of its Throat Pouch to that type.
2 - Ring of Protection. Increase Stomatosuchus' AC by 1.
3 - Holy Symbol. Stomatosuchus gains immunity to radiant damage.
4 - Gold Coins. Stomatosuchus' throat pouch deals an additional {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and it regurgitates 100 gp when slain.

5 - Wand Shard. Stomatosuchus knows the Firebolt, Ray of Frost, or {@spell Thunderclap|XGE} cantrip. It can cast them as though it were level 5, its spell attack modifier is +4 and any saving throw from its cantrips has a DC of 14.
6 - Ticking Clock. Stomatosuchus loses its Size Matters ability and becomes exceptionally aggressive. It also constantly makes a faint ticking sound.

items.name: Treasure Trove
entries: When Stomatosuchus is slain, it's throat pouch contains {@dice 1d4} trinkets, small items, or gemstones (DM's choice, typically including whatever is described above)

trait.name: Reactionary Thermoregulation
entries: When hit by an attack or when making a saving throw, Spinosaurus may use its reaction to gain immunity to fire or cold damage until the end of the turn.

trait.name: Crocodile Mimic
entries: Spinosaurus can hold its breath for up to 30 minutes.

trait.name: Rostral Dermal Pressure Sensors
entries: While submerged in water, Spinosaurus has a blindsight of 10 ft. (included above).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Spinosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make one Snapping Jaw attack and one Hooked Claw attack.

action.name: Snapping Jaw
entries: {@atk mw} +9, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d6 + 10}) piercing damage.

A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) and pulled 5 ft. closer to Spinosaurus. While a creature is {@condition grappled} by this attack, Spinosaurus cannot attack another target with its Snapping Jaw.

action.name: Hooked Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +9, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) slashing damage.
A creature hit by this attack can be moved up to 5 ft. in any direction by Spinosaurus (no save allowed).

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Spinosaurus' CR to 8 and increase its XP to 3900 accordingly.

entries.name: Dramatic Reinterpretation
entries: Select one option listed below and apply it to Spinosaurus. The next time the party encounter a Spinosaurus, select a different option, which overrides the previously selected option.
- Increase Spinosaurus' strength to 28, but decrease its dexterity to 10. Its attacks deal {@damage 1d8} additional damage (of the same damage type), but subtract 2 from any rolls to hit.
- Change Spinosaurus' speed to 60 ft., but it may no longer swim.
- Increase Spinosaurus' AC to 20.
- Spinosaurus gains a fly speed of 40 ft. (This may not be selected the first time a party encounter Spinosaurus).

items.name: Dramatic Reinterpretation
entries: Select one option listed below and apply it to Spinosaurus. The next time the party encounter a Spinosaurus, select a different option, which overrides the previously selected option.
- Increase Spinosaurus' strength to 28, but decrease its dexterity to 10. Its attacks deal {@damage 1d8} additional damage (of the same damage type), but subtract 2 from any rolls to hit.
- Change Spinosaurus' speed to 60 ft., but it may no longer swim.
- Increase Spinosaurus' AC to 20.
- Spinosaurus gains a fly speed of 40 ft. (This may not be selected the first time a party encounter Spinosaurus).

trait.name: Dexterous Aquatic Predator
entries: While submerged in water, the Bahariyan Polycotylid has advantage on Dexterity checks, advantage on Dexterity saving throws, advantage on saving throws to prevent it from being {@condition restrained}, and cannot be knocked {@condition prone}. The Bahariyan Polycotylid can also hold its breath for up to 10 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If the Bahariyan Polycotylid chooses the attack action, it may make one Swim-by Bite attack and one Paddle Slap attack.
Swim-by Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: +7, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Paddle Slap
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d4 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stir Mud
entries: If submerged in water, as an action, the Bahariyan Polycotylid can use its paddles to stir up sediment from the riverbed/seabed. For 30 seconds all connected water within 30 ft. becomes clouded with mud, rendering it opaque. A creature submerged in this water is considered blind and heavily obscured.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Bahariyan Polycotylid's CR to 6 and increase its XP to 2300 accordingly.

entries.name: Echosnap
entries: The Bahariyan Polycotylid has a blindsight of 40 ft.

items.name: Echosnap
entries: The Bahariyan Polycotylid has a blindsight of 40 ft.

trait.name: Thick Feathered Coat
entries: Yutyrannus has immunity to cold damage and resistance to non-magical bludgeoning and piercing damage (all included above).
If Yutyrannus falls below half health, it loses its resistance to piercing and bludgeoning damage and replaces its immunity to cold damage with resistance to cold damage.

trait.name: Arch-Predator
entries: Yutyrannus cannot be easily swayed from the hunt. It has advantage on Charisma and Wisdom saving throws.

action.name: Call the Pack (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Yutyrannus can let out a gut-wrenching bellow alerting other members of its pack to the conflict.
At the start of the next round, up to two additional Yutyrannus join the combat as allies to this Yutyrannus.
They approach from nearby cover and do not have the Call the Pack ability.

If this ability is used by a polymorphed or otherwise shapeshifted humanoid, their friends, family, or party members are considered to be their 'pack' instead, and are made aware of the conflict, regardless of where they are.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Yutyrannus chooses the attack action, it may make one Feathermaw Bite attack and two Feathered Claw attacks.

action.name: Feathermaw Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +11, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) piercing damage. If a creature hit by this attack is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the Yutyrannus cannot Feathermaw Bite another target.

action.name: Feathered Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Downy Shoulder Bash
entries: {@atk mw} +11, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If Yutyrannus moved at least 30 ft. before using this attack, a creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If Yutyrannus knocks a creature {@condition prone} with this attack, it may then make a single Feathered Claw attack against that creature.

legendary.name: Legendary Action: Coordinate
entries: Yutyrannus signals its pack with grumbles and tail flicks. On its next turn, Yutyrannus has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that has at least one other Yutyrannus within 10 ft. of it that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

legendary.name: Legendary Action: Hunt
entries: Yutyrannus searches for its prey. It may make a {@skill Perception} check. If a hidden creature within 60 ft. has taken damage, Yutyrannus has advantage on this check, specifically for detecting that creature (disregard the additional {@dice d20} for all uninjured creatures).

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Yutyrannus' CR to 14 and increase its XP to 11500 accordingly.

entries.name: Legendary Might
entries: Yutyrannus may take an additional legendary action (increasing its total to 2).

entries.name: Legendary Action: Frost Bellow {@recharge 5}
entries: Yutyrannus bellows an unnaturally cold roar. Each creature in a 20 ft. cone in front of it must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 40 ({@damage 10d8}) cold damage and have their movement speed reduced by 10 ft. (to a minimum of 5 ft.). On a successful save they take half as much damage and are otherwise unaffected.

entries.name: Legendary Action: Frenzy
entries: Yutyrannus may move up to 5 ft. and make a Feathered Claw attack.

items.name: Legendary Might
entries: Yutyrannus may take an additional legendary action (increasing its total to 2).

items.name: Legendary Action: Frost Bellow {@recharge 5}
entries: Yutyrannus bellows an unnaturally cold roar. Each creature in a 20 ft. cone in front of it must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 40 ({@damage 10d8}) cold damage and have their movement speed reduced by 10 ft. (to a minimum of 5 ft.). On a successful save they take half as much damage and are otherwise unaffected.

items.name: Legendary Action: Frenzy
entries: Yutyrannus may move up to 5 ft. and make a Feathered Claw attack.

trait.name: Quilled Back
entries: The quills on Psittacosaurus' back make it dangerous to hit. If Psittacosaurus is hit by a melee attack, it may use its reaction to make a Quill Stab attack at the attacking creature.

trait.name: Vast Herd
entries: Psittacosaurus swarm in vast herds of dozens to hundreds of individuals, roaming the mountainsides, rivers, and hills. When fleeing from a threat, it is difficult to make out individual Psittacosaurus among the crowd.
So long as there are three or more Psittacosaurus fleeing within 20 ft. of each other, ranged attacks against them are at disadvantage.

trait.name: Group Sentinel
entries: If three or more Psittacosaurus are together, select one of them to be the Group Sentinel. That Psittacosaurus has advantage on {@skill Perception} checks.

action.name: Beak Snap
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Quill Stab
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change Psittacosaurus' CR.

entries.name: Quill Spray
entries: As an action, Psittacosaurus can fire a spray of quills. Each creature in a 10 ft. cone in front of Psittacosaurus must succeed a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d4 + 1} piercing damage.

items.name: Quill Spray
entries: As an action, Psittacosaurus can fire a spray of quills. Each creature in a 10 ft. cone in front of Psittacosaurus must succeed a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d4 + 1} piercing damage.

trait.name: Arboreal
entries: If Microraptor uses the Dash action, do not increase its flight speed, but instead triple its climb speed.
Microraptor also has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks while in a wooded or forested environment.

trait.name: Feathered and Evasive
