entries: When making a Dexterity saving throw to take half damage from an attack, spell, or effect, Microraptor instead takes no damage if the saving throw is succeeded. Microraptor also has resistance to cold damage (included above).

action.name: Scratch
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d2 + 1}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change Microraptor's CR.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: Microraptor may be used as a familiar via the {@spell Find Familiar} spell or any similar effect.

entries.name: Shimmering Feathers (2/Day)
entries: Microraptor is protected by a layer of iridescent feathers that can be used to misdirect and confuse attackers. When hit by an attack, Microraptor can use its reaction to increase its AC by 2 until the end of the turn.

items.name: Familiar
entries: Microraptor may be used as a familiar via the {@spell Find Familiar} spell or any similar effect.

items.name: Shimmering Feathers (2/Day)
entries: Microraptor is protected by a layer of iridescent feathers that can be used to misdirect and confuse attackers. When hit by an attack, Microraptor can use its reaction to increase its AC by 2 until the end of the turn.

trait.name: Altruistic Behaviour
entries: When attacked, a herd of Bolong will tend to flee. However, one will always stay behind to buy time for the others to escape. That Bolong will attack and fight to the death. The other individuals will only fight if they are cornered or cannot escape.

trait.name: Thundering Charge
entries: If Bolong moves at least 20 ft. in a straight line before using its Crushing Bulk attack, that attack deals an additional {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage this turn, but also deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage to Bolong on a successful hit.

trait.name: Defensive Gouge
entries: If Bolong is hit by a melee attack, it may use its reaction to make a single Thumb Gouge attack at the creature that hit it.

action.name: Crushing Bulk
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Thumb Gouge
entries: {@atk mw} +5, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change Bolong's CR.

entries.name: Bo's Dragon {@recharge 4}
entries: As an action, Bolong may spit a ball of burning ash at a point within 20 ft. of it. The ground within a 10 ft. radius from that point is engulfed in burning embers and flame.

For the next minute, any creature that starts its turn within or moves into this area must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6 + 3} fire damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

entries.name: Dragon's Legacy
entries: Bolong has resistance to fire damage.

items.name: Dragon's Legacy
entries: Bolong has resistance to fire damage.

items.name: Bo's Dragon {@recharge 4}
entries: As an action, Bolong may spit a ball of burning ash at a point within 20 ft. of it. The ground within a 10 ft. radius from that point is engulfed in burning embers and flame.

For the next minute, any creature that starts its turn within or moves into this area must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6 + 3} fire damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

trait.name: Titanic Fighter
entries: Carcharodontosaurus has advantage on attacks against creatures with a size category of Large, Huge, or Gargantuan. Carcharodontosaurus also has resistance to slashing damage (included above).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Carcharodontosaurus fails a saving throw, it may choose to succeed it instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Carcharodontosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make three Ripping Bite attacks.

action.name: Ripping Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +11, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage.
When a creature is hit by this attack, if it is not already affected by the 'Torn' condition, it gains the 'Torn' condition (see below).

action.name: Condition:
entries: Torn. A torn creature has had a large piece of flesh ripped away from its body and is bleeding heavily.

At the start of its turn in combat or every minute outside of combat, the creature must succeed a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} slashing damage. On a successful save they take half as much damage.
This effect persists until one of the following occurs:
- The creature is healed by at least 25 hit points.
- The creature finishes a long rest (do not make saves while resting but begin again if the rest is interrupted).
- A {@dc 18} {@skill Medicine} check is passed on the creature.
- A {@spell lesser restoration} spell is cast on the creature.
- It dies.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Carcharodontosaurus' CR to 12 and increase its XP to 8400 accordingly.

entries.name: Hyper Adaptations
entries: You may choose or roll for one major mutation (page 227) and two minor mutations (page 218). Carcharodontosaurus gains these mutations

entries.name: Legendary Actions
entries: Carcharodontosaurus can take {@b 1 legendary action}, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Carcharodontosaurus regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

entries.name: Legendary Action: Adapt
entries: Roll a {@dice d20}, on a 10 to 20, you may replace one of Carcharodontosaurus' mutations with another of your choice from the same table. On the roll of a 1 to 9 you must replace one of Carcharodontosaurus' mutations with another randomly determined mutation from the same table.

items.name: Hyper Adaptations
entries: You may choose or roll for one major mutation (page 227) and two minor mutations (page 218). Carcharodontosaurus gains these mutations

legendary.name: Legendary Action: Adapt
entries: Roll a {@dice d20}, on a 10 to 20, you may replace one of Carcharodontosaurus' mutations with another of your choice from the same table. On the roll of a 1 to 9 you must replace one of Carcharodontosaurus' mutations with another randomly determined mutation from the same table.

trait.name: Immutable Stature
entries: Paralititan is immune to being {@condition frightened} or knocked {@condition prone} (included above). It has advantage on Strength saving throws, and any saving throw to resist being {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition poisoned}. However, it automatically fails any Dexterity saving throw.
Non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing attacks have no effect on it as its hide is far too thick (included above). Attacks from Huge, Gargantuan, and Colossal creatures bypass this immunity.

trait.name: Bellowing Call
entries: As a bonus action, Paralititan may let out a bellowing call. This is a deep guttural rumble that shakes the very core of other creatures. Each other non-Paralititan creature within 60 ft. must succeed a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of Paralititan for 1 minute.
They may repeat this save at the end of their turn and on a successful save are immune to the effect for 24 hours.

action.name: Rear Up
entries: As an action, Paralititan can rear up onto its hind limbs. If it does, its speed is reduced to 0 ft. and it is able to use its Almighty Stomp attack until it is no longer rearing up.
If Paralititan takes the attack action, or makes an attack of opportunity as a reaction, it lands on all fours and it ceases rearing up.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Paralititan chooses the attack action, it may make two Huge Stomp attacks. Alternatively, it may make a single Almighty Stomp attack if it is rearing up.

action.name: Huge Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} +11, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Almighty Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} +15, reach 10 ft., up to two targets. {@h}75 ({@damage 10d10 + 20}) bludgeoning damage. Paralititan must be rearing up to use this attack.

Any creature hit by this attack is knocked {@condition prone}. All other non-sauropod creatures within 30 ft. of Paralititan must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or also be knocked {@condition prone}. Any non-magical metal, stone, or wooden object not being carried or worn hit by this attack is shattered and destroyed.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Paralititan's CR to 11 and increase its XP to 7200 accordingly.

entries.name: Lightning Rod
entries: The first time Paralititan uses its Bellowing Call ability each day, the sky darkens and storm clouds form directly above it. For the next hour, each time Paralititan uses its Bellowing Call, any creature within 20 ft. of it (including itself) must succeed a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} lightning damage. They take half as much damage on a successful save.
After an hour passes, the storm clears.

items.name: Lightning Rod
entries: The first time Paralititan uses its Bellowing Call ability each day, the sky darkens and storm clouds form directly above it. For the next hour, each time Paralititan uses its Bellowing Call, any creature within 20 ft. of it (including itself) must succeed a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} lightning damage. They take half as much damage on a successful save.
After an hour passes, the storm clears.

trait.name: Bipedal Shift
entries: If Iguanodon chooses the Dash action, its base speed is increased to 40 ft. until the start of its next turn (dashing up to 80 ft.).

trait.name: Bellow Cheeks
entries: As a bonus action, Iguanodon may inflate its cheeks and create a loud bellowing sound. If it does, all other Iguanodon within 500 ft. become aware that it is in danger and will either flock to help, or flee the area.
Ossified Tendons: Iguanodon has advantage on Strength saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Iguanodon chooses the attack action, it may make two Thumb Gore attacks and one Bulk Throw attack.

action.name: Thumb Gore
entries: {@atk mw} +8, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bulk Throw
entries: {@atk mw} +10, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

Iguanodon throws its weight around. A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If Iguanodon misses with this attack, it must succeed a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change Iguanodon's CR.

entries.name: Crystal Palace Horned History
entries: You may choose for Iguanodon to have a much more lizard-like appearance and a large, pointed horn on its snout instead of clawed thumbs. If you do, replace all instances of "Thumb Gore" in its stat block with "Horn Gore".

entries.name: The Bone Wars
entries: One of two greedy palaeontologists (Marsh or Cope) refuse to allow anyone to study Iguanodon's remains and have hidden explosives on every member of this species. If Iguanodon is slain, do not end combat. A loud ticking sound can be heard emanating from its remains and, after 2 rounds, they detonate with a large explosion.

Each creature within a 15 ft. radius of Iguanodon's remains must succeed a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} fire damage and {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage. On a success they take half as much damage. Iguanodon's remains are then completely destroyed and irrecoverable.

items.name: Crystal Palace Horned History
entries: You may choose for Iguanodon to have a much more lizard-like appearance and a large, pointed horn on its snout instead of clawed thumbs. If you do, replace all instances of "Thumb Gore" in its stat block with "Horn Gore".

items.name: The Bone Wars
entries: One of two greedy palaeontologists (Marsh or Cope) refuse to allow anyone to study Iguanodon's remains and have hidden explosives on every member of this species. If Iguanodon is slain, do not end combat. A loud ticking sound can be heard emanating from its remains and, after 2 rounds, they detonate with a large explosion.

Each creature within a 15 ft. radius of Iguanodon's remains must succeed a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} fire damage and {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage. On a success they take half as much damage. Iguanodon's remains are then completely destroyed and irrecoverable.

trait.name: Nocturnal
entries: Juravenator has darkvision 120 ft. (included above) and can see as if in bright light up to 60 ft. It is generally only active at night.

trait.name: Fatty Water-Wader
entries: Juravenator has resistance to cold damage (included above) and advantage on attacks against creatures submerged in water that are smaller than itself.

trait.name: Quick Reflexes
entries: Juravenator can dash as a bonus action and has advantage on Dexterity saving throws and checks.

action.name: Quick Snap
entries: {@atk mw} +2, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d2}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, change Juravenator's CR to 1/8 and increase its XP to 25 accordingly.

entries.name: Adult Form: Borb
entries: Juravenator has a chubby and puffedup feathered appearance. Double its hit points, movement speed, to-hit bonus, and its damage becomes {@dice 1d4}.
Juravenator gains resistance to bludgeoning damage and its size category is Small.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: Alternatively, you can choose to not increase Juravenator's CR and remove the Adult Form: Borb optional rule. Juravenator may then be used as a familiar via the {@spell Find Familiar} spell or any similar effect. If you wish, it may still maintain the appearance described in Adult Form: Borb.

items.name: Adult Form: Borb
entries: Juravenator has a chubby and puffedup feathered appearance. Double its hit points, movement speed, to-hit bonus, and its damage becomes {@dice 1d4}.
Juravenator gains resistance to bludgeoning damage and its size category is Small.

items.name: Familiar
entries: Alternatively, you can choose to not increase Juravenator's CR and remove the Adult Form: Borb optional rule. Juravenator may then be used as a familiar via the {@spell Find Familiar} spell or any similar effect. If you wish, it may still maintain the appearance described in Adult Form: Borb.

action.name: Quick Snap
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Reactionary Strike
entries: When Kentrosaurus is hit by a melee attack, it can use its reaction to make a single Thagomise attack at the creature that attacked it.

trait.name: Sexually Dimorphic
entries: Male and female Kentrosaurus differ in appearance. In a herd of 3 or more Kentrosaurus, select
1-2 animals to be male. They are a different colour than the females.

trait.name: Vicious Defences
entries: A creature damaged by an attack made by Kentrosaurus using its Reactionary Strike must succeed a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of Kentrosaurus for 1 minute. At the end of that creature's turn, it may repeat the saving throw. On a successful save it is no longer {@condition frightened} of Kentrosaurus and is immune to Vicious Defences for 24 hours.

trait.name: Anterior-Facing Spikes
entries: A creature attacking Kentrosaurus does not gain advantage for any ability or effect that would grant them advantage on attacks for outnumbering or flanking Kentrosaurus.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: When Kentrosaurus chooses the attack action, it can make two Thagomise attacks, or a single Tailsweep attack.

action.name: Thagomise
entries: {@atk mw} +6, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tailsweep
entries: {@atk mw} +6, reach 10 ft., up to three targets. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change Kentrosaurus' CR.

entries.name: The Hoodening
entries: Channelling Kentish folklore, Kentrosaurus is able to magically disguise itself as a horse. It will appear to be a wild horse to any observer. The disguise can be discerned by a {@dc 15} {@skill Investigation} check, or is revealed when Kentrosaurus attacks.

While Kentrosaurus is disguised as a horse, any creature that attempts to mount or ride it suffers {@damage 2d10} piercing damage and the disguise is revealed. If a creature otherwise attempts to touch Kentrosaurus, they take {@damage 1d4} piercing damage and are made aware that something is amiss.

items.name: The Hoodening
entries: Channelling Kentish folklore, Kentrosaurus is able to magically disguise itself as a horse. It will appear to be a wild horse to any observer. The disguise can be discerned by a {@dc 15} {@skill Investigation} check, or is revealed when Kentrosaurus attacks.

While Kentrosaurus is disguised as a horse, any creature that attempts to mount or ride it suffers {@damage 2d10} piercing damage and the disguise is revealed. If a creature otherwise attempts to touch Kentrosaurus, they take {@damage 1d4} piercing damage and are made aware that something is amiss.

trait.name: Snatch Feeder
entries: If Klobiodon is flying, it does not provoke attacks of opportunity when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Tooth Cage
entries: If Klobiodon hits a creature with its Toothed Gnaw attack, Klobiodon can opt to grasp onto it.

Whenever that creature moves, Klobiodon moves with it (without using any of its own movement) and is considered to be occupying the same space as it. While grasping onto a creature, Klobiodon's AC is 10.
As an action, the hit creature may make a {@dc 8} Strength saving throw to remove Klobiodon, ending this effect and pushing Klobiodon 5 ft. directly away from it on a success.
Alternatively, Klobiodon may choose to end this effect at any time.

A creature with Klobiodon grasping onto it has its movement speed reduced by 5 ft. and takes {@damage 1d2} piercing damage at the start of its turn. These effects are cumulative if more than one Klobiodon is grasping a single creature.

action.name: Toothed Gnaw
entries: {@atk mw} +2, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Optional Magical Rules
entries: If you choose to use the optional magical rules listed below, you do not need to change Klobiodon's CR.

entries.name: Hiding in Plain Sight
entries: Klobiodon's fossils sat unassigned to a new species for decades in a museum drawer. As long as Klobiodon is motionless, it is {@condition invisible}. In the first round of combat, if Klobiodon was {@condition invisible} at the start of the round, its Toothed Gnaw deals an additional {@damage 1d4} piercing damage this round.

items.name: Hiding in Plain Sight
entries: Klobiodon's fossils sat unassigned to a new species for decades in a museum drawer. As long as Klobiodon is motionless, it is {@condition invisible}. In the first round of combat, if Klobiodon was {@condition invisible} at the start of the round, its Toothed Gnaw deals an additional {@damage 1d4} piercing damage this round.

trait.name: River Skulker
entries: Kulindadromeus has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks while in thick foliage and can attempt to hide in sparse foliage or shallow water that would normally be too exposed to hide in. It also has darkvision 40 ft. and a passive {@skill Perception} of 16 (both included above).

trait.name: Protofeathered Wader
entries: Reduce any cold damage Kulindadromeus takes by {@dice 1d4} and it is not slowed by muddy difficult terrain.

trait.name: Progenitor of Giants
entries: Kulindadromeus is among the first of the major herbivore lineage

trait.name: Ornithischia
entries: All other herbivores within this lineage (Heterodontosaurs, Stegosaurs, Ankylosaurs, Iguanodontids, Hadrosaurs, etc. (e.g. Bolong (48), Iguanodon (135), Kentrosaurus (139), Scelidosaurus (172), Struthiosaurus (93), and Zuul (188) in this book)) treat Kulindadromeus as a close relative and will protect it with their lives. They will ward off any threats to Kulindadromeus and ensure that it can feed safely.

action.name: Beaked Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} +2, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Deep Diver
entries: Leptonectes can hold its breath for 2 hours and has resistance to cold and thunder damage (included above).

trait.name: Large Fusiform
entries: While in water, Leptonectes cannot be {@condition grappled} by creatures smaller than itself and is immune to the spell Tidal Wave (or similar effects).

action.name: Snout Skewer
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage. If Leptonectes swam at least 40 ft. in a straight line before using this attack this turn, it deals an additional {@damage 2d6} piercing damage.

action.name: Giant Paddle Slap
entries: Each other creature within 5 ft. of Leptonectes must succeed a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 1d8} thunder damage

action.name: Grimace
entries: Leptonectes has a downturned jaw, giving it the appearance of having a permanent grimace or sneer.

As an action, Leptonectes can draw upon this feature, radiating displeasure in a magical aura. Each other creature within 20 ft. that can see Leptonectes must succeed a {@dc 11} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the end of their next turn.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Sneering Swipe. Leptonectes may swim up to 5 ft. then make a Snout Skewer attack (this attack cannot benefit from the additional damage).

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Mastodonsaurus can breathe in both air and water. When in water, it gains a +3 bonus to Dexterity saving throws.

trait.name: Dermal Pressure Sensors
entries: While in water, Mastodonsaurus has a blindsight of 30 ft. (included above).

trait.name: Perfect Ambusher
entries: While motionless at the bottom of a body of water, Mastodonsaurus is indistinguishable from the sediment. If it attacks from this position, it is always considered to be first in the initiative order (regardless of all other abilities, like the Alert feat), has advantage on its first attack, and that attack deals an additional {@damage 1d10} piercing damage.

trait.name: Gurgling Energies
entries: When a creature is hit by Tusked Bite, it must succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} damage. Roll a {@dice d4} and consult the list below to determine the type of damage this ability deals.
Additionally, Mastodonsaurus gains immunity to that damage type until its next turn. {@dice d4} Type 1 Fire 2 Cold 3 Lightning 4 Force

action.name: Tusked Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +8, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage.
A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

monster.name: Megalosaurus
monster.pbNote: +3 King of its Time. Megalosaurus was the arch-predator of the British Bathonian. It has advantage on attacks against creatures that are the same size category as itself. Scrotum humanum. Megalosaurus takes triple damage from the cantrip Vicious Mockery. First of its Kind. The first time a humanoid (including player characters) sees Megalosaurus while within 60 ft. of it, they are affected by a curse that causes them to momentarily lose all understanding of dinosaurs and other Mesozoic creatures (no save allowed). The curse persists for two rounds or until they take damage. For each creature afflicted, roll a d4 and consult the table below to determine how they behave:

entries: Curious - The humanoid becomes unaware of any threat Megalosaurus poses. They cannot attack it or cast detrimental spells/cantrips against it and must move directly towards it if possible.

Threatened - On the humanoid's next turn, they must make a ranged or melee attack against Megalosaurus or cast a cantrip that targets it. If the humanoid has Multiattack, they instead only make a single attack.

3. Adoring - The humanoid must attempt to feed or heal Megalosaurus on their next turn. Megalosaurus can accept food as a reaction and will then prioritise killing other creatures over any that have fed it or healed it.
4. Terrified - The humanoid becomes {@condition frightened} of Megalosaurus.

action.name: Combination Multiattack
entries: If Megalosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make two Predatory Strike attacks.
However, each of those Predatory Strike attacks must choose a different damage type.

action.name: Predatory Strike
entries: {@atk mw} +6, Reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@dice 2d6 + 4}) (see below) damage.
Megalosaurus lashes out with one of its myriad attacks
- headbutting, clawing, biting, or lashing with its tail.
When making a Predatory Strike, you can select either bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing as the damage type.

legendary.name: Rampant Thrashing
entries: Megalosaurus disengages and may move up to 10 ft.

legendary.name: Predatory Gile
entries: Megalosaurus positions itself to take down a target. Choose a creature it can see. If its next attack hits that creature, that creature is also knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Speciose
entries: Early Titanosaurs diversified rapidly. Each time the party encounters a new Mnyamawamtuka (including this one), select or roll for an adaptation on the Minor Mutation Table (page 218). Apply that mutation to that Mnyamawamtuka. You do not need to increase Mnyamawamtuka's CR for the mutation gained.

trait.name: Columnar Limbs
entries: Mnyamawamtuka's strong legs make it exceedingly difficult to topple. It has an additional +5 modifier and advantage on saving throws to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}. However, Mnyamawamtuka has a further
-3 modifier (total -5, included above) and disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

trait.name: Heart-Shaped Soul
entries: Any creature hit by an attack from Mnyamawamtuka must succeed a {@dc 10} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by Mnyamawamtuka for 1 minutes, fetching food for it. If the {@condition charmed} creature takes any damage, the effect ends. Once this charm wears off or is removed, the creature cannot be affected by this ability again for 24 hours.
Mnyamawamtuka prioritises attacking non-{@condition charmed} creatures

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Mnyamawamtuka chooses the attack action, it may make one Shovelling Bite attack and two Whipping Tail attacks.

action.name: Shovelling Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.
Mnyamawamtuka's semi-spatulate shaped teeth pull at any target they bite. A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or drop an item it is wielding.

action.name: Whipping Tail
entries: {@atk mw} +5, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Diver
entries: Mosasaurus can hold its breath for up to 2 hours.

trait.name: Ocean Tyrant
entries: Mosasaurus has advantage on Mighty Jaw attacks against other creatures native to an ocean setting.

trait.name: Stormrider
entries: Mosasaurus has resistance to cold, lightning, and thunder damage (included above).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Mosasaurus chooses the attack action, it may make one Mighty Jaw attack and one Concussive Splash attack.

action.name: Mighty Jaw
entries: {@atk mw} +13, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) piercing damage.
Any target hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or take an additional {@damage 2d8} piercing damage from Mosasaurus' palatal teeth.

action.name: Concussive Splash
entries: Each creature in a 20 ft. cone in front of Mosasaurus must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) thunder damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

action.name: Stormbringer
entries: As a bonus action, Mosasaurus may summon a storm. This storm persists for 1 hour.

action.name: Rogue Wave {@recharge 4}
entries: Once a storm has been summoned, as an action, Mosasaurus can cast {@spell Tidal Wave|XGE} without requiring a spell slot or components. Additionally, Mosasaurus itself is immune to the effects of Tidal Wave.
Mosasaurus can only use Rogue Wave up to four times per day.

trait.name: Ocean Farer
entries: Nothosaurus has resistance to cold and thunder damage (included above).

trait.name: Diverse
entries: Nothosaurus come in a variety of colours with different skin patterns.

trait.name: Aquatic Reptile
entries: Nothosaurus can hold its breath for up to 10 minutes and has advantage on Dexterity saving throws while submerged in water.

trait.name: Basking
entries: If Nothosaurus spends at least 10 minutes basking in the sun on land, it gains immunity to cold damage for 1 hour.

trait.name: Charged Skin
entries: Nothosaurus is immune to lightning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: When Nothosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make two Piercing Bite attacks and one Neck Whack attack.

action.name: Piercing Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Neck Whack
entries: {@atk mw} +5, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spit Lightning
entries: {@atk rw} +5, range 100 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) lightning damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Dive. Nothosaurus swims up to 15 ft.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Lightning Overload (Recharge 4-6). Each other creature within 15 ft. of Nothosaurus must succeed a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) lightning damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

trait.name: Handless
entries: Nyctosaurus has only one finger on each hand, which is utilised by its wing to support the membrane. It cannot climb any surface.

trait.name: Inter-Continental Migrator
entries: Nyctosaurus can fly for up to a week without needing to stop. It can sleep while flying, although its fly speed is reduced to 30 ft., and it can only fly in a straight line while it does so.

trait.name: Snatch Feeder
entries: If Nyctosaurus is flying, it does not provoke attacks of opportunity when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: "Night Lizard" (2/Day)
entries: Nyctosaurus can cast {@spell Darkness} at will without requiring components or a spell slot. However, it automatically loses {@status concentration} if it takes any damage.
Nyctosaurus has a blindsight of 60 ft.

trait.name: Aura of Blindsight
entries: Any other friendly Nyctosaurus that starts its turn within or moves within 100 ft. of this Nyctosaurus gains a blindsight of 10 ft. for 1 minute if it was not already using these optional magical rules.

action.name: Headcrest 'Antler' Crash
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.
Nyctosaurus may only perform this attack if it flew at least 50 ft. this turn.
When Nyctosaurus makes this attack, it lands on the ground.

action.name: Beaked Peck
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Brooder
entries: Oviraptor are excellent parents and fiercely territorial of their nests. If Oviraptor is defending its nest, it attacks recklessly, giving it advantage on all attacks, but all attacks against it also have advantage.

trait.name: Crested Head Flush (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Oviraptor can flush its crest with blood, giving it a vivid appearance.
It gains advantage on Charisma checks and Charisma saving throws for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Feathered
entries: When hit by an attack, Oviraptor can use its reaction to reduce any incoming bludgeoning damage by
{@dice 1d4}. When taking falling damage, Oviraptor can use its reaction to reduce the falling damage it takes by {@dice 2d10}.

trait.name: Egg/Offspring Thief
entries: The original misinterpretation of Oviraptor as opportunistic egg thieves, when all evidence shows that they were actually attentive parents has left a bitter resentment within all Oviraptor.

These creatures will now steal eggs and/or young of other species (including humanoids), but rather than devouring them, will instead care for them diligently and raise them as their own. Oviraptor gains proficiency in {@skill Stealth} checks while stealing offspring.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: When choosing the attack action, Oviraptor may make one Snapping Beak attack and one Clawed Scratch attack.

action.name: Snapping Beak
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Clawed Scratch
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage

trait.name: Filter-Feeder
entries: Pterodaustro cannot be {@condition poisoned} or damaged by contaminated or laced food or water.

trait.name: Quad-Launch (Pterodaustro)
entries: If not already flying, as a bonus action, Pterodaustro can launch itself into the air.

Every other creature within 5 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 8} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Pterodaustro then begins to fly and must fly 10 ft. in a straight line (either horizontally, or vertically up).
Pterodaustro can only begin flying by using this ability, or if it is falling.

trait.name: Group Sentinel
entries: If three or more Pterodaustro are together, select one of them to be the Group Sentinel. That Pterodaustro has advantage on {@skill Perception} checks.

trait.name: Swallowed Gemstone
entries: When encountering a group of Pterodaustro, one or more of them may be enchanted with a magical element from a gemstone they have swallowed. That Pterodaustro will glow with a soft hue and the damage type of its attacks will change to the corresponding type for that gemstone. You may roll a {@dice d10} or select from the table below to determine the gemstone swallowed, colour hue, and damage type: {@dice d10} Gemstone, Colour, Type 1 Ruby, Red, Fire 2 Sapphire, Sky Blue, Cold 3 Topaz, Yellow, Lightning 4 Augite, Black, Poison 5 Jade, Green, Acid 6 Tanzanite, Cerulean, Thunder 7 Citrine, Golden, Radiant 8 Amethyst, Purple, Psychic 9 Malachite, Viridian, Necrotic 10 Labradorite, Iridescent Rainbow, Force When Pterodaustro is slain, the gemstone it swallowed is regurgitated (worth 50 gp).

action.name: Wing-Buffet
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Quad Launch (Quetzalcoatlus)
entries: If not already flying, as a bonus action, Quetzalcoatlus can launch itself into the air. Every other creature within 10 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
Quetzalcoatlus then begins to fly and must fly 20 ft. in a straight line (either horizontally, or vertically up).
Quetzalcoatlus can only begin flying by using this ability, or if it is falling.

trait.name: Stalking Stalk, Silent Glider
entries: If Quetzalcoatlus is walking within a forest or is flying, it has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks.

trait.name: Vicious Descent
entries: If Quetzalcoatlus began the turn flying and subsequently lands before making an attack, increase the damage of its first Colossal Peck attack by {@dice 1d10} this turn.

trait.name: Eye in the Sky
entries: While fling, Quetzalcoatlus has advantage on {@skill Perception} checks that involve sight.

trait.name: Low-Gravity Aura
entries: Quetzalcoatlus drastically reduces the weight of objects and creatures in contact with it (including itself). A real Quetzalcoatlus would usually be able to carry a maximum weight of about 80-100 lb. This ability to increases its carry weight limit to 500 lb. and any howdah or saddle attached to it are considered weightless for the purposes of its carry weight. For each 100 lb. Quetzalcoatlus is carrying, reduce its fly speed by 10 ft.

trait.name: Aircraft-Sized Animal
entries: Quetzalcoatlus can carry up to three Medium (or smaller) humanoids on its back, and two further Medium (or smaller) humanoids in its hind claws. For each creature carried in this way, Quetzalcoatlus' fly speed is reduced by 10 ft.
If Quetzalcoatlus is carrying two or more creatures using this rule, it cannot use its Lift Off action.

trait.name: Feathered God
entries: You may choose for Quetzalcoatlus to be covered in vivid feathers.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: When Quetzalcoatlus chooses the attack action, it may make three Colossal Peck attacks.

action.name: Colossal Peck
entries: {@atk mw} +8, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage. If a creature hit by this attack is Medium or Small in size, it must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Thunderous Flap {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within a 15 ft. radius in front of Quetzalcoatlus (a semi-circle with the centre of the flat edge positioned on Quetzalcoatlus) must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 17 ({@dice 5d6}) bludgeoning and 17 ({@damage 5d6}) thunder damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

action.name: Lift Off
entries: While flying, as an action, Quetzalcoatlus may pick up an object (usually) weighing up to 500 lb. and up to Large in size. While carrying this object, it's fly speed is reduced by 10 ft. for each 100 lb. the object weighs.

Quetzalcoatlus may drop a carried object at any point during its turn. If this object is dropped on a creature, that creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage for each 100 lb. the object weighs. If the object is dropped from 50 ft. or higher, the bludgeoning damage is doubled, but the Dexterity saving throw DC is reduced to 12.

trait.name: Morbid Regurgitation
entries: Rhamphorhynchus vomits up its stomach contents upon death. When Rhamphorhynchus dies, one creature within 5 ft. must succeed a {@dc 8} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} acid damage.

trait.name: Swooping Evasion
entries: If Rhamphorhynchus is flying, it can use its reaction to increase its AC by 3 when an enemy makes an attack of opportunity against it.
Rhamphorhynchus can use its reaction to give itself advantage on any Dexterity saving throw when forced to make one.

trait.name: Growth Spurt
entries: Rhamphorhynchus can be found as either a juvenile (Tiny) or adult (Small) creature.

trait.name: Snatch & Swallow
entries: When hitting with its Spike-Toothed Snap attack, Rhamphorhynchus may opt to deal no damage and instead try to snatch and swallow a small item (trinket, potion, wand, dagger, etc.) that it can see on the hit creature. The hit creature must succeed a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or have the item snatched and swallowed by Rhamphorhynchus.
If the item is magical, Spike-Toothed Snap becomes a magical attack and deals a damage type appropriate to the item (i.e., a swallowed Wand of Magic Missile changes it to force damage).
If the item provides healing (i.e., a healing potion), Rhamphorhynchus gains {@dice 1d4 + 2} temporary hit points.
Any swallowed non-food or non-potion item is regurgitated upon Rhamphorhynchus' death, and potions are regurgitated as empty vials.

action.name: Spike-Toothed Snap
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Morbid Regurgitation (Swarm)
entries: Each time Rhamphorhynchus (Swarm) drops below the hit point thresholds of 34, 24, 14, and 4, one of its members vomits up its stomach contents. One creature within 5 ft. of Rhamphorhynchus (Swarm) must succeed a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} acid damage.

trait.name: Swarming Flurry
entries: Melee attacks against Rhamphorhynchus (Swarm) are made at disadvantage.

trait.name: Naive Juveniles
entries: This swarm is composed entirely of inexperienced juvenile animals. It has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny beast. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

The swarm is immune to being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition grappled}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained}, and {@condition stunned} (included above).

trait.name: Enchanted Swarm
entries: Rhamphorhynchus (Swarm) has already snatched dozens of magical items and incorporated them into their attacks. Each time Rhamphorhynchus swarm makes a Spike-Toothed Snap attack, you may roll a {@dice d10} and change the damage type of the attack according to the list below: {@damage d10} Damage 1 Fire 2 Cold 3 Lightning 4 Poison 5 Force 6 Psychic 7 Thunder 8 Necrotic 9 Acid 10 Radiant

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Whenever Rhamphorhynchus (Swarm) chooses the attack action, it can make up to five Spike- Toothed Snap attacks.

action.name: Spike-Toothed Snap
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Razor Osteoderms
entries: Any creature that hits Scelidosaurus with a melee attack suffers {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.
Scelidosaurus may use its reaction to increase this to {@damage 2d4} slashing damage.
Scelidosaurus is resistant to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage (included above).

trait.name: Oblivious
entries: Scelidosaurus automatically fails any Intelligence saving throws.

trait.name: Domesticatable
entries: Scelidosaurus is particularly trustful of Small or Medium-sized creatures, largely due to its formidable defences. It is relatively easy to domesticate, and players can befriend a Scelidosaurus by feeding it consistently for a {@dice 1d4 + 1} days. However, their Razor Osteoderms prevent Scelidosaurus from being ridden without a bespoke saddle. Nevertheless, they make for friendly travelling companions

action.name: Serrated Tail
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Pelvic Membrane
entries: Sharovipteryx is immune to falling damage and can move up to 2 ft. horizontally for every 1 ft. it descends in the air, at no movement cost.
While descending in the air in this manner (or while flying if you are using the optional magical rules), Sharovipteryx does not provoke attacks of opportunity when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Familiar
entries: Sharovipteryx may be used as a familiar via the {@spell Find Familiar} spell or any similar effect.

action.name: Gliding Snap
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 (1) piercing damage.
Sharovipteryx may only use this attack while descending in the air (or while flying if you are using the optional magical rules).

action.name: Podopteryx (1/Day)
entries: As an action, Sharovipteryx can take on the appearance of its original namesake, the Damselfly Podopteryx, for one minute. During this time, it gains a 40 ft. fly speed, its size becomes Miniscule, and its AC becomes 17.

trait.name: Dip Feeder
entries: Tanystropheus has advantage on attacks against creatures that are submerged in water, so long as Tanystropheus' body is not also submerged in water.
Tanystropheus can hold its breath for 5 minutes.

trait.name: Farstrike
entries: Tanystropheus often attacks from a concealed position, hiding its body while reaching out with its long neck to strike prey.
If Tanystropheus attacks while hidden, its first attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} piercing damage.

trait.name: Basal Hydra
entries: Increase Tanystropheus' Hit Points to 58. Each time Tanystropheus takes damage, it grows an additional head up to a maximum of six. When Tanystropheus uses Multiattack, it may make an additional Nip attack for each head beyond the first, up to a maximum of six Nip attacks.
Tanystropheus starts with two heads.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Tanystropheus chooses the attack action, it may make one Neck Strike attack and one Nip attack.

action.name: Neck Strike
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.
A Medium or Small creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (their choice) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Nip
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Leaping Ambush
entries: If Utahraptor was hidden at the start of its turn, it's Razor-Clawed Kick gains the following benefits this turn:
- An additional {@hit 3} to hit.
- An additional {@damage 1d8 + 3} slashing damage (as the weight of Utahraptor rends its claws down the target's body).
- Any Medium or smaller creature hit by it is knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Athletic and Pneumatized
entries: Utahraptor can jump up to 30 ft. from standing and it takes half damage from falling.

trait.name: Grappling Predator
entries: If a creature smaller than Utahraptor is hit by Utahraptor's Razor-Clawed Kick, that creature is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}).
If a creature the same size category as, or larger than, Utahraptor is hit by two Razor-Clawed Kick attacks in the same turn, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}).

trait.name: Social Hunter
entries: If more than one Utahraptor is tracking a creature together, they all have advantage on {@skill Survival} and {@skill Perception} checks to track that creature.

trait.name: Mimicking Cry
entries: Utahraptor can imitate the sound of any creature or noise it has heard with accuracy, much like a parrot. It tends to use this ability while hiding to lure prey closer to it.
If a creature uses its action to examine the sound, it can determine that it is a mimicked effect with a successful {@dc 14} {@skill Investigation} check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Utahraptor chooses the attack action, it may make one Vicious Bite attack and one Razor-Clawed Kick attack.

action.name: Vicious Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +6, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Razor-Clawed Kick
entries: {@atk mw} +6, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Feathered and Pneumatized
entries: Velociraptor can leap up to 15ft. from standing. It takes no damage from falling, unless {@condition incapacitated} in which case it takes half damage instead.

trait.name: Grasping Predator
entries: If Velociraptor hits a creature the same size or larger than itself with its Clawed Kick, it can opt to grasp onto it. Whenever that creature moves, Velociraptor moves with it (without using any of its own movement) and is considered to be occupying the same space as it. A Small creature is {@condition grappled} while Velociraptor is grasping onto it.
As an action, the hit creature may make a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw to remove Velociraptor, ending this effect and pushing Velociraptor 5 ft. directly away from it on a success.
Alternatively, Velociraptor may choose to end this effect at any time.
If two or more Velociraptor are grasping the same Medium or Large creature with this ability, halve its movement speed.

trait.name: Silent Ambush
entries: Velociraptor can move without making a sound. It automatically passes any {@skill Stealth} check to avoid being detected by sound while hidden. Other creature's {@skill Perception} checks that would detect Velociraptor only by sound automatically fail.

trait.name: Vivid Familial Groups
entries: Each time the party encounter Velociraptor, it may be present in groups of 3-6 animals, representing a family group. Some of these animals may be hidden nearby. This group consists of an adult male, adult female, and 1-4 subadult animals.
These animals all share a similar dazzling under-plumage that is hidden by overlying feathers (it does not hinder their ability to be stealthy) and is unique to their group.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Velociraptor chooses the attack action, it may make one Sharp Bite attack and one Clawed Kick attack.

action.name: Sharp Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Clawed Kick
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dazzling Reveal
entries: As an action, Velociraptor may unleash a dazzling array of magical display feathers. One enemy creature within 30 ft. of Velociraptor must succeed a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} damage of a damage type that corresponds to their plumage colour, or psychic damage (DM's choice).

trait.name: Burst of Speed
entries: Young Tyrannosaurus can dash as a bonus action.

trait.name: Naive
entries: Young Tyrannosaurus has a -3 modifier to Wisdom saving throws (included above).

trait.name: Tailswipe
entries: As a bonus action, Young Tyrannosaurus may swipe at a single creature within 5 ft. with its tail.

That creature must succeed a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. Young Tyrannosaurus cannot target a creature with this ability that it is currently grappling.

trait.name: Cliff Scene
entries: When Young Tyrannosaurus is reduced to 0 hit points, it lets out a shrill cry. A few moments later, the roar of two adult Tyrannosaurus rex can be heard in the distance.

After one minute, two Tyrannosaurus Rex (Basic Rules, pg. 157) appear and attack the party, focusing initially on whoever reduced the Young Tyrannosaurus to 0 hit points. If another adult Tyrannosaurus is already present, this affect does not occur.

action.name: Snapping Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage.
A Medium or smaller creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Young Tyrannosaurus cannot Snapping Bite another target while grappling a creature.

trait.name: Ankylosaur Osteoderms
entries: Zuul is resistant to non-magical bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage, has an AC of 20, a -10 modifier to {@skill Acrobatics}, and a -8 modifier to {@skill Athletics} (excluding for shove and grapple checks, all included above).

trait.name: Hulking Mass
entries: Zuul has disadvantage on all Dexterity saving throws, but advantage on all Constitution and Strength saving throws.

trait.name: Ectoplasmic Reach
entries: A ghoulish jelly like substance extends the from Zuul's tail. Increase the reach of Zuul's Clubbed Tail attack to 15 ft. and change its damage type to necrotic.

action.name: Clubbed Tail
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Any creature knocked {@condition prone} by this attack (or was already {@condition prone}) must then succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or suffer a "shattering blow" and have their movement speed reduced by 10 ft.

A {@spell lesser restoration} spell, equivalent effect, or long rest is required to remove "shattering blow". Multiple "shattering blows" are cumulative, reducing a creatures movement speed by 10 ft. for each blow (to a minimum of 5 ft.).

action.name: The Gatekeeper (1/Day)
entries: As an action, Zuul can attempt to open an interdimensional portal directly in front of it that ejects malicious energies. Roll a {@dice d20}: On a 1, Zuul detonates with malicious magical energies, dealing {@damage 8d8} necrotic damage to itself and {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage to each other creature within 25 ft.

On a 2-10, an unstable portal forms for 1 minute and pulses with malicious energy. Each creature (other than Zuul) within 25 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage. As a bonus action, Zuul can pulse the portal, forcing this save again.

On an 11-19 a metastable portal forms for 1 minute and crackles with malicious energy. Each creature (other than Zuul) within 25 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage and gain vulnerability to necrotic damage for 1 minute. As a bonus action, Zuul can pulse the portal, forcing this save again.
On a 20 a stable portal opens for 1 minute. Each creature (other than Zuul) that starts its turn within or moves within 25 ft. of the portal gains vulnerability to necrotic damage.
At the start of their turn, any creature (other than Zuul) within 25 ft. of the portal suffers {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage.
If Zuul is slain, the portal it created either closes or stabilises to another plane of existence (DM's decision) for {@dice 1d20} minutes.

trait.name: Power Over Speed
entries: Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex has advantage on all Strength checks and Strength saving throws, but disadvantage on all Dexterity checks and Dexterity saving throws.

trait.name: Territorial Titan
entries: Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex has advantage on attacks with its Strongest Bite against creatures with a size category of Huge or Gargantuan.

trait.name: When Dinosaurs Ruled the Earth
entries: All non-Tyrannosaurus beasts are {@condition frightened} of Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex.

Every minute while within line of sight of Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex, or at the end of each of its turns in combat, a beast can make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw to become immune to this ability for 24 hours. Succeeding this Wisdom saving throw does not make it immune to Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex's Iconic Bellow.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex fails a saving throw, it may choose to succeed it instead.

trait.name: Imparted Speech
entries: Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex can understand Archosauric and another language of your choosing (usually Common). It can speak Archosauric, albeit slowly. Increase its Intelligence score to 8.

trait.name: Wise Old Beast
entries: Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex chooses the attack action, it may make one Strongest Bite attack and one Crushing Tail Slam attack.

action.name: Strongest Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +13, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d12 + 4}) piercing damage plus 23 ({@damage 3d12 + 4}) force damage.

A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 21}). Until this grapple ends, Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex can't Strongest Bite another target and has an additional {@hit 5} to hit the {@condition grappled} creature with any Strongest Bite attack.

action.name: Crushing Tail Slam
entries: Each creature within 10 ft. of Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex must succeed a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 3d12 + 9}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a success they take half as much damage and are not knocked {@condition prone}.
A creature {@condition grappled} by Strongest Bite is not affected by this attack.

action.name: Iconic Bellow
entries: Every non-Tyrannosaur creature within 200 ft. of Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex that can hear it must succeed a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 1d12 + 7}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} of Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex for 1 minute. A creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the {@condition frightened} condition from Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex's Iconic Bellow for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Lunging Head Bash
entries: Ancient Tyrannosaurus rex may move up to 10 ft., then make the following attack:

legendary.name: Lunging Head Bash
entries: {@atk mw} +13, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Steady Healing
entries: At the end of Big Al's turn, she recovers 8 hit points. Big Al is resistant to necrotic damage (included above).

trait.name: Clumsy
entries: Whenever Big Al begins moving, roll a {@dice d20}. On the roll of a 1, Big Al instead stumbles and trips directly forward 10 ft, is knocked {@condition prone}, suffers {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage, and cannot move for the rest of her turn.
If Big Al is below 10 hit points, she stumbles on a roll of 1-10, rather than just 1.

trait.name: Subadult
entries: Big Al's Wisdom stat is reduced to 6 (included above) and she cannot gain advantage on any Wisdom checks or Wisdom saving throws.

trait.name: Stalker
entries: The first time each day that Big Al fails a {@skill Stealth} check, she may instead choose to succeed it.

trait.name: Starving
entries: The first time an {@skill Animal Handling} check is made against Big Al each day, if that check utilises food suitable for a carnivore, it automatically succeeds.
If Big Al is fed, she'll periodically return to whoever fed her of her own accord for more food.

trait.name: Big Al's Ballad
entries: When Big Al awakens at dawn each day or is in combat, dramatic orchestral music plays loudly centred over her location and all of Big Al's choices, thoughts, and actions are also narrated by a disembodied, stoic British voice. This music and voice can only be heard by player characters.

trait.name: Story Set in Stone
entries: Big Al cannot be killed by normal means. If Big Al is reduced to 0 hit points or suffers an effect that would kill her, she instead falls to 1 hit point, cannot attack, loses her Steady Healing ability, and will flee from combat.

She can only take lethal damage from her Clumsy ability. If she does not trip while fleeing, she will wander for 24 hours, then die emaciated on the nearest riverbank. However, if Big Al is healed during this 24 hour period (excluding from a short/ long rest), she regains her Steady Healing ability, is able to attack again, and may behave normally.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Big Al chooses the attack action, she may make one Big Al's Maw attack and one Big Al's Claws attack.

action.name: Big Al's Maw
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Big Al's Claws
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Olfactory Enlargement
entries: Carnotaurus has a +10 bonus to any {@skill Perception} check that involves smell. If its sense of smell is hindered or lost, it instead has a -10 modifier and disadvantage on any {@skill Perception} check that involves smell.

trait.name: Explosive Ambush!
entries: In the first round of combat, Carnotaurus may dash as a bonus action.

trait.name: Scent of Prey
entries: Carnotaurus has advantage on {@skill Survival} checks to pursue prey.

trait.name: Possible Pack Mentality
entries: All Carnotaurus treat other Carnotaurus as allies.

trait.name: Venerated Headwear
entries: Local people venerate the Carnotaurus and worship them by adorning them with a variety of headdresses as they sleep. This is seen as a right-of-passage or coming-of-age ceremony by some cultures and is a test of an individual's stealth and sleight of hand. With Carnotaurus' short arms unable to reach its head, headwear may stay on one for several weeks or months. This headwear is often crafted from expensive silks or inlaid with precious gemstones and can be highly valuable (we recommend a value of {@dice 2d100 + 50} gp). This leads to Carnotaurus sometimes being targeted by bandits for raids which, more often than not, results in an easy meal for the Carnotaurus.
Stolen headdresses are seen as contraband by their respective cultures.

trait.name: A Familiar Smell
entries: Carnotaurus becomes accustomed to the smell of its Venerated Headwear and will instinctively follow its scent if stolen. A player or NPC harbouring stolen Venerated Headwear will be hunted by its respective Carnotaurus.
That Carnotaurus automatically passes any {@skill Perception} check to detect its Venerated Headwear that involves smell.
If that Carnotaurus is alive and not {@condition incapacitated}, roll a {@dice d6} whenever the harbouring player/NPC takes a long rest.
On a 5 or 6, the Carnotaurus interrupts and attacks them during that long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Carnotaurus chooses the attack action, it may make two Slashing Bite attacks and one Brow Horn Gore attack.

action.name: Slashing Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Brow Horn Gore
entries: {@atk mw} +6, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.
A creature hit by this attack must make a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Grasping Forelimbs
entries: Dilophosaurus can grapple as a bonus action. However, while grappling a creature, Dilophosaurus cannot use its Dextrous Claws attack.

trait.name: Dual Skull Crests
entries: As a bonus action, Dilophosaurus may flush its crests with blood, giving them a bold red colour. If it does so, it has advantage on {@skill Intimidation} checks for 1 minute.

trait.name: Apparent Fragility
entries: Dilophosaurus appears to be a fragile animal, but it is in fact much hardier than it looks. The first time Dilophosaurus is reduced to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead. Once this feature has been used it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

trait.name: Agile Hunter
entries: Dilophosaurus has advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

trait.name: Anthesis to Spitting
entries: Dilophosaurus could never spit venom and it despises all suggestions that it should.

This has given it an innate magical aura that protects it from similar attacks. All ranged attacks against Dilophosaurus are made at disadvantage. Additionally, Dilophosaurus is immune to poison and acid damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Dilophosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make one Recurved Bite attack and one Dextrous Claws attack. Alternatively, it may make a single Neck Sweep attack.

action.name: Recurved Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.
A Medium or smaller creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or drop an item they are wielding.

action.name: Dextrous Claws
entries: {@atk mw} +5, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Neck Sweep
entries: Each creature within a 10 ft. cone in front of Dilophosaurus must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a success they take half as much damage and are not knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Subsurface Monster
entries: Wretchglow, the Last Light can hold its breath for up to 10 hours and has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks while submerged in water.
If Wretchglow, the Last Light is hidden, as a bonus action it can create an illusionary lure, following the same rules as its Bioluminescent Lure legendary action.

trait.name: Bioluminescence
entries: Wretchglow, the Last Light can opt to emit a dull glow of any colour, creating dim light for 40 ft. around it. It can activate/deactivate this light at will at any point but, while active, it cannot hide.

trait.name: Oscillating Thermoregulation
entries: Wretchglow, the Last Light has resistance to fire and cold damage (included above).

trait.name: Intelligent
entries: Wretchglow, the Last Light is capable of planning in combat and is able to utilise its environment to help defeat foes (i.e., drowning foes or causing cave collapses).

trait.name: Rostral Dermal Pressure Sensors
entries: While in water, Wretchglow, the Last Light has a blindsight of 10 ft. (included above).

action.name: Bioluminescent Flash {@recharge 5}
entries: As an action, Wretchglow, the Last Light can unleash a huge flash of light.
Each other creature within 40 ft. that can see it must succeed a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for two rounds.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Wretchglow, the Last Light chooses the attack action, it can make one Colossal Needle-Toothed Jaws attack and one Hooked Claw attack.

action.name: Colossal Needle-Toothed Jaws
entries: {@atk mw} +11, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 6d6 + 11}) piercing damage.
A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}).
While a creature is {@condition grappled} by this attack, Wretchglow, the Last Light cannot attack another target with its Colossal Needle-Toothed Jaws attack.

action.name: Hooked Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +11, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d8 + 11}) slashing damage.
A creature hit by this attack can be moved up to 5 ft. in any direction by Wretchglow, the Last Light (no save allowed).

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Misdirecting Strobe. Each creature within 40 ft. of Wretchglow, the Last Light that can see it must succeed a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of their next turn.
If they roll a natural 1 on the Dexterity saving throw, they are instead {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Direct Currents. So long as Wretchglow, the Last Light is submerged in water, it may pick up to 4 creatures within 60 ft. who are also submerged in connected water and move them up to 10 ft. in any direction, so long as they remain submerged in water.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Bioluminescent Lure. Wretchglow, the Last Light creates a visual illusion up to 10ft. in size that must be within 30 ft. of itself. The illusion ends if Wretchglow, the Last Light moves more than 30 ft. away from it, if it uses this legendary action again, or if it chooses to dismiss the illusion.
Any other creature that sees the illusion must succeed a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, or perceive the illusion as real (and generally be drawn to it).
On its turn, a creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful {@dc 16} {@skill Investigation} check

trait.name: Reactionary Crystalline Regulation
entries: Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror may use its reaction to gain immunity to fire, cold, lightning, thunder, acid, poison, radiant, necrotic, psychic, or force damage until its next turn. The crystals on its body visibly flicker/crackle/bubble with energies of the associated damage type.
This immunity is in addition to any gained by its Elemental Absorb legendary action.

trait.name: Surging Power
entries: At the start of Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror's turn, select one of the following effects:
1. It may make an additional Hooked Claw attack this turn.
2. It may dash as a bonus action this turn.
3. Each creature within 10 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} lightning damage.
It has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Semi-Aquatic
entries: Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror can hold its breath for up to 30 minutes.

trait.name: Rostral Dermal Pressure Sensors
entries: While in water (or lava), Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror has a blindsight of 10 ft. (included above).

trait.name: Crystalline Form
entries: Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror is immune to any effect that would charm or petrify it (included above).

action.name: Unleash Energies {@recharge 5}
entries: Crackling magical energies erupt from Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror. Each other creature within 40 ft. must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d10} lightning damage and {@damage 6d6} force damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror chooses the attack action, it may make one Shardmaw Bite attack and one Hooked Claw attack.

action.name: Shardmaw Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +12, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d6 + 12}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage.

action.name: Hooked Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +12, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d8 + 12}) slashing damage.
A creature hit by this attack can be moved up to 5 ft. in any direction by Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror (no save allowed).

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Shard Breath (Recharge 3-6). Ranged Weapon Attack: +6, range 10 ft. cone, up to four targets {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Elemental Absorb. Until its next turn, Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror gains immunity to one damage type from the list below, however if it has already gained an immunity from this ability, it instead replaces it. Its crystals change colour to the associated colour.
Fire (red)
Cold (blue)
Lightning (yellow)
4. Poison (green) This immunity is in addition to any gained from its Reactionary Crystalline Regulation ability.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Prismatic Glow. Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror produces a bright light, illuminating an area of up to 60 ft. with bright white light and a further 60 ft. with dim light (total 120 ft.). Each other creature within 10 ft. of it takes {@damage 1d10} radiant damage (no save allowed).
If Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror has used Elemental Absorb this turn, the light is that associated colour instead.

trait.name: Pinning Grapple
entries: Pluvenn Villager has an additional +3 bonus to Strength checks when attempting to grapple a  creature. If a creature is {@condition grappled} by Pluvenn Villager, it takes {@damage 1d4 - 1} piercing damage (minimum of 1).

trait.name: Nocturnal/Diurnal
entries: Pluvenn Villager only requires 4 hours of sleep per day.

items: {@skill Performance}
{@skill Persuasion}
{@skill Religion}

trait.name: Community Member
entries: Select one skill from the list below, this Pluvenn Villager gains a +3 bonus to any checks for that skill. Alternatively, you can select any tool (excluding Forgery Kit, Poisoner's Kit, and Thieves' Tools) and this  Pluvenn Villager instead gains proficiency with that tool and an additional +2 bonus to any checks with it.

items: {@skill Animal Handling}
{@skill History}
{@skill Medicine}
{@skill Nature} This Pluvenn Villager should be appropriately dressed to  match their community contribution/role.

action.name: Razormaw Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +2, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Pluvenn Flowertender's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks).
It may cast the following spells:

trait.name: Rose Picker
entries: Pluvenn Flowertender has resistance to  non-magical piercing damage (included above).

trait.name: Pinning Grapple
entries: Pluvenn Flowertender has an  additional +3 bonus to Strength checks when attempting to grapple a creature. If a creature is {@condition grappled} by Pluvenn Flowertender, it takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage.

trait.name: Nocturnal/Diurnal
entries: Pluvenn Flowertender only requires 4 hours of sleep per day

action.name: Weed-Pulling Razormaw
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage

monster.name: Pluvenn Huntleader
languages: any three (usually Common, Archosauric, and one other language)

trait.name: Pinning Grapple
entries: Pluvenn Huntleader has an additional
+3 bonus to Strength checks when attempting to grapple a  creature. If a creature is {@condition grappled} by Pluvenn Huntleader, it takes {@damage 1d4 + 3} piercing damage.

trait.name: Master of the Hunt
entries: Pluvenn Huntleader only requires 4 hours of sleep per day, unless pursuing a marked target, in which case it only requires 2 hours of sleep per day.
Pluvenn Huntleader also has advantage on {@skill Athletics} checks for climbing.

trait.name: Endure Pain
entries: When hit by an attack, Pluvenn Huntleader can use its reaction to give itself resistance to either non?magical bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Mark Target
entries: As a bonus action, Pluvenn Huntleader can apply a magical mark to a target that it can see within 60 ft. The mark is a blood-red, dully-glowing symbol.

The mark can only be removed via magical means (i.e. {@spell Dispel Magic} or a similar effect), if the marked creature dies, or if Pluvenn Huntleader dies. Alternatively, Pluvenn Huntleader may dismiss the mark at will.
Pluvenn Huntleader has advantage on {@skill Survival} checks to  pursue a marked target and its attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage (of the same damage type) to the target.
Only one mark per Pluvenn Huntleader may be active at  a time.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Pluvenn Huntleader chooses the attack action, it may make any combination of three attacks with any of the  weapons listed below.

action.name: Exquisite Longsword (+1)
entries: {@atk mw} +10, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:10 ({@dice 1d8 + 6}) magical slashing damage.

action.name: Wrist Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} +9, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Grappling Hook
entries: {@atk rw} +9, range 40 ft., one target. {@h}2 (2) piercing damage.

A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Only one creature may be {@condition grappled} by this attack at a time. Pluvenn Huntleader does not gain the benefits of "Pinning Grapple" when grappling with this attack.
Pluvenn Huntleader can only end the grapple from this  attack as a bonus action.

monster.name: Manyhorn Guild Broker
languages: any three (usually Common, Archosauric, and one other)

trait.name: Flush Crest (2/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Guild Broker can flush its head crest with blood, giving itself advantage on  Charisma checks for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Horned Repose
entries: If a creature fails to hit Guild Broker with a  melee attack while within 5 ft. of it, Guild Broker may use its  reaction to make a Horn Skewer attack back at that creature.

trait.name: Guild Knowledge
entries: Any party member known by a member of  Guild Broker's guild for at least 24 hours is also known by

trait.name: Guild Broker
entries: Additionally, Guild Broker knows any details that other members of its guild have learnt about them.

trait.name: Shrewd Negotiator
entries: Guild Broker has advantage on  {@skill Persuasion} checks and is immune to the {@condition charmed} condition (included above).

trait.name: Hip-Shooter
entries: An enemy being within 5 ft. of Guild Broker does not cause it to have disadvantage when making a  ranged attack with its Concealed Hand Crossbow. Guild Broker's Concealed Hand Crossbow is hidden until fired.

action.name: Broke Peace
entries: As an action, Guild Broker can call for a truce. Each enemy that can hear Guild Broker and  understands at least one of the languages that Guild Broker speaks must succeed a {@dc 11} Charisma saving throw or consider Guild Broker to no longer be an enemy and may not attack Guild Broker (or any member of Guild Broker's guild), unless it or one of its guild Members attacks first or otherwise breaks the peace. A creature that  is particularly hostile to Guild Broker makes its Charisma saving throw at advantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Guild Broker chooses the attack action, it may make two Concealed Hand Crossbow attacks.

action.name: Concealed Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} +3, range 30/120, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage. If the first attack made by Guild Broker in combat is with  this weapon, the attack is made at advantage and deals an  additional {@damage 1d6} piercing damage.

action.name: Horn Skewer
entries: {@atk mw} +4, Reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) damage.

monster.name: Manyhorn Guild Elder
languages: any three (usually Common, Archosauric, and one other)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Manyhorn Guild Elder's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It may cast the following spells:

trait.name: Flush Crest (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Guild Elder can flush its head crest with blood, giving itself advantage on  Charisma checks for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Horned Repose
entries: If a creature fails to hit Guild Elder with a  melee attack while within 5 ft. of it, Guild Elder may use its  reaction to make a Horn Skewer attack back at that creature.

trait.name: Guild Knowledge
entries: Any party member known by a member of Guild Elder's guild for at least 24 hours is also known

trait.name: by Guild Elder
entries: Additionally, Guild Elder knows any details that other members of its guild have learnt about them.

trait.name: Guild Master
entries: Any non-Guild Elder member of Guild Elder's guild will defend Guild Elder with their lives.

action.name: Guild Command
entries: As a bonus action, Guild Elder can command any other non-Guild Elder member of its guild who can hear it. That creature may immediately move up to its maximum walking speed and take an action.

action.name: Horn Skewer
entries: {@atk mw} +6, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Ceremonial Guild Sword (+1)
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@dice 1d6 + 4}) magical piercing damage.

trait.name: Flush Crest (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Guild Initiate can flush its head crest with blood, giving itself advantage on  Charisma checks for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Horned Repose
entries: If a creature fails to hit Guild Initiate with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it, Guild Initiate may use its reaction to make a Horn Skewer attack back at  that creature.

trait.name: Guild Knowledge
entries: Any party member known by a member of  Guild Initiate's guild for at least 24 hours is also known by

trait.name: Guild Initiate
entries: Additionally, Guild Initiate knows any details that other members of its guild have learnt about them.

action.name: Guild Mace
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn Skewer
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Jeholrak Politician
languages: any four (usually Common, Archosauric, and two other languages)

trait.name: Demagogue
entries: In addition to other spells, once per day, the Jeholrak Politician may cast {@spell Mass Suggestion} (at 6th level, with a spell save DC of 13) without material components. Player characters are unaffected by this spell unless they are currently {@condition charmed} by Jeholrak Politician.

trait.name: Pheromonal Influence
